The system shall ensure consistency in the entry and exit conditions of each mode, properly handle the functional control resolution process under different states and operational phases when issuing the "Cancel Cruise" command, and verify the functional inputs to analyze the correctness of functional handling in scenarios such as "operational phase not considered" or "state not considered."

The system should output the control status at appropriate times that meet scenario requirements, ensuring the correctness and timeliness of 'Cancel Cruise' command execution, and have corresponding logging and monitoring mechanisms for post-event analysis and optimization.

requirement: When sending the "Resume Route" command, exit from lateral command control and transition from the current position to the original route to the point.
safety_requirements: When sending the "Resume Route" command, the system should correctly exit lateral command control and transition from the current position back to the original route to the waypoint, ensuring continuity and accuracy of the flight path.

The system shall perform a real-time status check when issuing the "Resume Route" command, ensuring the current position matches the original route's waypoints, and trigger the warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should be able to handle situations where the sending end resumes data transmission after an exception, ensuring the receiving end can properly receive data again, and perform data verification and error correction when necessary.

When the conditions for redundancy switching are met, the system shall ensure that the output values of the currently running functions do not become abnormal, maintaining the system's stability and reliability.

After a software power failure and restart during system state execution, a state check should be performed to analyze the correctness of state execution in cases such as 'state not recovered' or 'error recovery' after restarting, and necessary corrective actions should be taken.

The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships among the control logic of each functional point, avoid potential conflicts and errors, and guarantee the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: The commands "Cancel Altitude Hold," "Cancel Speed Hold," and "Resume Route" are only valid when in the command control mode and after the corresponding command to enter command control has been sent.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the validity of the "Cancel Altitude Hold," "Cancel Speed Hold," and "Resume Route" commands, ensuring that these commands are executed only when in the command control mode and after the corresponding enter command control instruction has been sent.

When a software power failure and restart occur during system state execution, the system should check the state after restart to ensure correct state recovery. If the state is not recovered or is incorrectly recovered, an alert mechanism should be triggered.

The system should check functional inputs under different states and operational phases, analyze whether the operational phase and state are considered, and ensure the correctness of functional processing.

The system shall check interface data communication when the software experiences a power failure and restart, analyze interruptions, reconnections, and cases that cannot be restored in interface data communication, to ensure correctness of outputs.

The system should check the control solution results of the functions, analyze whether the control solution results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum or minimum values, to ensure the correctness of functional processing.

The system should be equipped with timeout detection for critical control or actions to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring system safety and reliability.

requirement: When a phase transition occurs or a control mode switch related to the remote control mode takes place, record the previous value of the throttle deflection command before the transition as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: The system shall record the previous value of the throttle opening command before transitioning between phases or switching control modes related to remote control mode, and verify its validity and accuracy to ensure the correctness of the soft start point.

The system should perform a boundary check on the old value of the throttle position command before conversion, ensuring it is within the allowed range, and trigger an exception handling mechanism when it exceeds the range.

When the system transitions between phases or switches control modes, it should check the values of functional interface data, and analyze the correctness and consistency of outputs when the values or their ranges change.

The system should check functional inputs under different states and operational phases, analyzing the correctness and consistency of functional processing in cases where operational phases or states have not been considered.

After a software power failure and subsequent restart, the system should check the status after reboot, analyze the correctness and consistency of the status execution in cases where the status fails to recover or recovers incorrectly, and trigger necessary recovery mechanisms.

The system shall ensure that the sequence and timing of control operations are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions, to guarantee the correctness and safety of functions.

requirement: After the effective processing of the commands "Cancel Altitude Hold," "Cancel Speed Hold," and "Resume Route," the control mode will revert to autonomous control only when the command control state has been exited in all three aspects: longitudinal, lateral, and speed. Otherwise, the command control mode remains active.
safety_requirements: After the system executes the commands 'Cancel Altitude Hold', 'Cancel Speed Hold', and 'Resume Route', it should check the longitudinal, lateral, and speed states to ensure that all command control states have been exited before resuming autonomous control mode.

After a software power failure and restart, the system should perform a status check to ensure correct status recovery. If the status is not recovered or incorrectly recovered, an alarm mechanism should be triggered and corrective actions taken.

The system should perform functional control calculations based on specific conditions under different states and operational phases to ensure that functional inputs are properly processed, taking into account the impact of the operational phase and state.

The system should check the functional control calculation results, analyze the correctness of handling normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum and minimum values, to ensure system stability and safety.

The system should implement timeout detection for critical controls or actions to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing the system from entering an unpredictable state.
The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: The remote control mode is divided into two types: remote control with inner loop and remote control without inner loop.
safety_requirements: The system should be able to distinguish between in-band loop remote control and non-in-band loop remote control modes, and perform control calculations correctly according to the current operating status and phase, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of remote control.

When the system is performing remote control, it should check the completeness and consistency of control conditions, ensure that the sequence and timing of remote control are coordinated with the hardware, and prevent errors caused by incomplete or inconsistent control conditions.

The system should correctly handle control solution results, including normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum and minimum values, to ensure the correctness and reliability of remote control, and should be able to provide warnings or corrections for abnormal situations.

The system should correctly manage the temporal relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships among functional control logics to ensure the correctness and reliability of remote control operations and prevent system failures caused by logic errors.

The system should be able to monitor the time of the control solution process, detect timeout situations, and provide warnings or corrections for timeouts, ensuring the timeliness and reliability of remote control and preventing system failures or losses caused by timeouts.

The system should be capable of recording and storing key data and events during remote control operations, including control resolution results, control conditions, timing relationships, etc., to facilitate post-event analysis and traceability, ensuring transparency and traceability of remote control.

requirement: Directly control the control surfaces (elevator, aileron, and rudder) via remote control without internal loop feedback, converting the remote control inputs to appropriate proportional outputs.
safety_requirements: When the system is performing control surface control, it should check the input of remote control manipulation to ensure its correctness, and perform corresponding proportional conversion and control calculation according to different operating states and stages.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of control surface operations are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions, to avoid safety issues caused by sequencing or timing errors.

The system should perform real-time checks on the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing when the control solution results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and ensure the accuracy and safety of control surface control.

The system should be capable of handling situations where different redundancies are in various operational states, analyzing the correctness of functional implementation when two or more redundancies are simultaneously in different states, ensuring the safety and stability of the system under complex conditions.

The system should have self-check and early warning mechanisms. When detecting abnormal control surface conditions or situations that may cause safety risks, it should promptly trigger warnings and take appropriate actions to ensure flight safety.

requirement: The in-band loop remote control converts the remote control manipulation into corresponding reference attitude angles, and calculates the corresponding rudder deflection control commands to control the control surfaces through autonomous control laws (Equations (2-1), (2-2), and (2-3)).
safety_requirements: The system should check the remote control inputs under different states and operational phases to ensure their correct conversion into the corresponding commanded attitude angles, and calculate the corresponding rudder deflection control commands according to the autonomous control laws (Equations (2-1), (2-2), and (2-3)).

The system shall perform real-time checks on rudder deflection control commands, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum and minimum values", and ensure compliance with control requirements.

The system's sequence and timing for control surface control should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the effectiveness and safety of the control.

The system should implement a timeout mechanism during the control solution process, and when a timeout occurs (no result returned within the specified time), it should trigger an early warning mechanism and take corresponding measures.
The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships among control logics of all functional points, to avoid safety risks caused by logic errors.
The system should monitor rudder angle control commands in real time and take immediate corrective actions upon detecting any anomalies to ensure the safety and stability of the system.

requirement: In both remote control modes, the remote control of the throttle valve is the same.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the control sequence and timing of the throttle valve are coordinated with the hardware in both remote control modes, guaranteeing complete and consistent control conditions.
The system should check whether the entry conditions and exit conditions for each remote control mode are consistent, to avoid conflicts or errors during mode switching.

After the system performs hardware control, it should monitor and evaluate the consistency between the hardware status and the control requirements in real-time to ensure the effectiveness and safety of remote operations.

The system should check and analyze functional inputs according to different operating statuses and phases, ensuring the correctness and safety of functional processing under conditions such as "unconsidered operating phase" or "unconsidered operating status".

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to monitor critical controls or actions, in order to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing the system from entering an unsafe state.

requirement: Remote control has the highest control authority and can switch to remote control mode at any time under any circumstances.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that a timeout detection mechanism is in place during the switch of remote control modes, to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing the system from entering an uncontrollable state.

When the system switches to remote control mode, it should check the functional inputs, analyze the correctness of function handling in different operational phases and states, and ensure the smoothness and safety of remote control.

The sequence and timing of remote control commands executed by the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be comprehensive and consistent to ensure system stability and reliability.

The system should check the results of remote control calculations, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, to ensure the accuracy and reliability of remote control.

When the system is under remote control, it should have a software power-failure restart protection mechanism to check the status after restarting, analyze the correctness of status execution in cases where the status fails to recover or recovers incorrectly after restarting, ensuring the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should record all operations and status changes of remote control to ensure that any issues or anomalies in the remote control process can be traced back and analyzed, thereby enhancing the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: When the aircraft is on the ground, the rudder deflection command for in-band loop remote control is calculated using the following formula: δy = KyY · Y + [Kyg (K · (-yg) + Ky · wy)] + Kywy · wy.
safety_requirements: When the system calculates the rudder deflection command, it should check whether the current aircraft status is ground status and ensure that the calculation formula is δy = KyY. Y + [Kyg (K. (-yg) + Ky. wy)] + Kywy. wy. If the status does not match, an error handling mechanism should be triggered.

The system shall perform real-time checks on the calculated results of the rudder deflection angle command, analyze whether the calculated results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum extreme values, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.

When the system calculates the rudder deflection command, it should ensure that control conditions are complete and consistent, and that control sequence and timing are coordinated with hardware. If inconsistencies are detected, calculation should be immediately stopped and an error reported.

The system should check the value accuracy of data bits in the interface data, analyze whether the value accuracy of data bits is greater than or equal to the required accuracy, and if not, adjust the value accuracy of data bits or trigger an error handling mechanism.

The system should check the data bit value accuracy of the interface data, analyze whether the data bit value accuracy is less than the required accuracy, and if not compliant, adjust the data bit value accuracy or trigger an error handling mechanism.

When calculating the rudder deflection command, the system shall check whether the operating phase and operating status have been taken into account. If not considered, an error handling mechanism shall be triggered.

requirement: Given the linear relationship between the attitude angles and the throttle deflection δp with the remote control inputs.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the linear correspondence between given attitude angles and throttle deflection δp and the remote control inputs is coordinated with the hardware in terms of control sequence and timing, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent.

The system should verify the temporal relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combination relationships among functional control logics to ensure the correctness and safety of control.

The system should check whether the rate of change of parameters is within a reasonable range (upper and lower slope limits) and define a handling strategy for out-of-slope data to ensure system stability and safety.
The system should monitor and determine the consistency between the hardware status and control requirements after performing hardware control, ensuring the correctness and safety of the system.

The system shall check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation in cases such as 'two or more redundancies are in different states', and ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should monitor the attitude angle and throttle deflection δp in real time to ensure they remain within the preset safety range, preventing system instability or failure caused by exceeding the limits.

requirement: The system should be capable of flying along pre-bound routes.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the control sequence and timing along the pre-bound flight path are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions, to avoid safety risks caused by improper control.

The system should check the execution sequence of various tasks, analyze the correctness of functional processing when the task execution sequence is inconsistent with the specified sequence, and ensure the safety and reliability of task execution.

The system shall ensure that software-related system safety requirements are adequately and accurately implemented in the software requirements or design documentation, to prevent safety hazards caused by software defects.
The system should analyze whether multiple functions executed simultaneously may operate on the same actuator, ensuring that no safety issues arise due to resource conflicts.
The system should perform a validity check on the equipment status before issuing hazardous control commands or actions, to prevent safety accidents caused by inconsistent equipment status.
The system should be capable of monitoring and recording key events and statuses during flight along pre-programmed routes, facilitating post-analysis and safety assessment.

requirement: The system should control the aircraft to maintain a constant altitude during the final approach phase, and when the navigation mode is set to final approach navigation, the flight phase should be reported as the final approach phase, with the control method consistent with the constant altitude segment.
safety_requirements: The system should check the current operational phase and status during the final approach leg, ensuring that the flight phase feedback is the final approach phase during altitude-hold flight and final approach navigation, and make corresponding control adjustments according to the control mode as in the altitude-hold phase.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the control solution process during the final approach flight phase, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "unconsidered operational phase" or "unconsidered operating status," and ensure the accuracy of the control solution results.

The system shall check the control solution results during the final approach phase, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum/minimum value" of the control solution results, and perform corresponding control adjustments based on the results.

The system shall ensure that the control sequence and timing during the final approach phase are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and that a warning mechanism is triggered in case of anomalies.

The system should check the status entry conditions during the fifth flight phase, analyze the correctness of status execution in cases where the entry conditions are "satisfied, not satisfied, satisfied again," etc., and make corresponding control adjustments based on the results.

The system should check the state transitions during the final approach phase, analyze the correctness of states and functions in scenarios such as "high-priority switching to low-priority" or "low-priority switching to high-priority," and ensure smooth state transitions.

requirement: The FCC collects necessary aircraft motion information, compares it with the required motion, obtains the deviation between the actual aircraft motion and the ideal motion, then based on this deviation, solves the control law to generate a control signal, and inputs this control signal to the relevant actuators, causing the control surfaces to deflect in a specific manner, thereby achieving control of the aircraft's attitude and motion.
safety_requirements: When collecting aircraft motion information, the FCC should check the validity and integrity of the input data to ensure that necessary aircraft motion information can be correctly obtained under different states and operational phases.

The FCC shall take into account the effects of operational phases and operating conditions when calculating deviations between the aircraft's actual and ideal motions, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the calculation results.

When solving the control laws, the FCC should check the legitimacy and validity of the control signals to ensure that correct control signals can be generated under different conditions (such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values).
The FCC should implement a timeout mechanism during the control solution process to ensure results are returned within the specified time, avoiding functional processing errors caused by timeouts.

When controlling the rudder actuator, the FCC should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and avoid safety risks caused by improper control.

The FCC should set up a timeout judgment mechanism when performing critical controls or actions to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring system safety and reliability.

The FCC should perform real-time monitoring and inspection of control signals to ensure their accuracy and reliability during transmission and execution, avoiding safety risks caused by signal distortion or loss.

requirement: In the first glide segment, the system should control the aircraft to descend along the pre-established glide path at a specified airspeed, from the final approach altitude to the end of the first glide segment altitude of 100m. The longitudinal control ensures the aircraft tracks the glide path height, while the lateral control eliminates any sideslip displacement relative to the airport runway axis. In the presence of crosswinds, the aircraft maintains zero sideslip angle.
safety_requirements: The system shall check the aircraft's current status and operational phase during the glide slope first segment to ensure the correctness of the control solution process and prevent errors caused by neglecting the operational phase or status.

The system shall perform real-time checks on the control solution results, ensuring correct handling when analysis results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, to guarantee the aircraft follows the pre-set glide path.

The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the correctness of longitudinal and lateral control of the aircraft.

The system shall check interface data with different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation in cases of single redundancy failure or complete redundancy failure, and ensure the safety of the aircraft.

The system should check whether the sensor measurement range is clearly defined, and report a sensor fault when the measured value exceeds the range, to ensure the accuracy of the control calculation results for the aircraft.
The system should ensure that the aircraft has no sideslip angle in crosswind conditions, and guarantee safe landing of the aircraft by eliminating its lateral deviation relative to the airport axis.

requirement: The system should control the aircraft during the second glide segment to descend from the end height of the first glide segment (100m) to the flare height (17m), enabling the aircraft to glide in a steady sideslip manner.
safety_requirements: When the system controls the aircraft's descent during the second glide segment, it should ensure that the aircraft glides in a straight sideslip manner from the end height of the first glide segment (100m) to the flare height (17m), with control sequence and timing coordinated with the hardware, and control conditions complete and consistent.

The system should check the control solution results for the glide slope segment 2, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as 'normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum/minimum value', to ensure the aircraft's safe descent.

During the system's glide slope segment control process, it should be capable of detecting whether the sensor acquisition range exceeds the upper or lower limits. When the acquisition range value is exceeded, a sensor fault should be reported and the warning mechanism triggered.

During the two-segment glide control process, the system should be capable of performing control calculations according to different operational phases and statuses, analyzing the correctness of functional handling in scenarios such as 'operational phase not considered' and 'operational status not considered', to ensure safe aircraft glide.

After power recovery or activation of the runaway reset mechanism, the system should be able to return to normal operation, continue controlling the aircraft's glide phase 2, and ensure safe landing of the aircraft.

requirement: During the flare phase, the system should level off the aircraft's flight path angle so that the aircraft lands with a small descent rate. The lateral control mode is the same as during the latter part of the glide.
safety_requirements: During the flare phase, the system should monitor the aircraft's flight path angle in real time and make adjustments based on the current and target states to ensure the aircraft lands with a low descent speed.
The system should check the consistency of the lateral control mode during the final approach phase to ensure complete and coherent control conditions, avoiding control conflicts.

The system should check functional inputs and analyze the correctness of functional processing in scenarios such as "omitted operational phases, omitted operating conditions," ensuring the accuracy of control solution processes.

The system should check the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum/minimum value", and ensure the stability and safety of the aircraft trajectory.

The system should check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation in cases such as "two or more redundancies are in different states," and ensure the overall safety and reliability of the system.
The system should monitor the aircraft's status and control parameters in real time, ensuring rapid response and correction in abnormal situations to prevent accidents.

requirement: The system should transition from the roll correction phase at a height of 1.5 meters to meet the conditions for switching to the landing rollout segment.
safety_requirements: During the roll-out phase, the system should monitor the roll-out altitude in real time and ensure that the conditions for transitioning to the landing rollout segment at a height of 1.5m are met, to prevent safety risks caused by altitude errors.

The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing during the roll correction phase are coordinated with the hardware, all control conditions are complete and consistent, avoiding safety hazards caused by control logic errors.

The system should monitor parameters in real time during the roll-out phase, ensure that the parameter change rate remains within a reasonable range (upper and lower slope limits), and have a clear handling strategy for over-slope data to prevent safety accidents caused by parameter anomalies.

The system should check the state transition conditions during the roll-out phase, analyze the correctness of state transitions under conditions such as "not set, always satisfied, and never satisfied," to ensure the safety and reliability of state transitions.

The system should set priorities for different functions during the roll-to-level phase, and analyze the correctness of states and functions in scenarios such as 'high priority switching to low priority' and 'low priority switching to high priority', ensuring the safety and reliability of the functions.

The system should set timeout checks for critical control actions during the roll attitude recovery phase to handle situations where hardware states fail to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing safety risks caused by timeouts.

requirement: The system should enter the landing rollout phase after receiving a remote control ground contact signal, a fully compressed landing gear signal, or 75 frames of abnormal link status during the landing rollout phase, using the rudder and brakes to correct the aircraft's lateral deviation distance and yaw angle relative to the runway axis.
safety_requirements: During the landing rollout phase, the system should be able to correctly receive the remote control grounding signal or the landing gear full compression signal. Upon receiving the signal, it should enter the landing rollout phase and use the rudder and brakes to correct the aircraft's lateral deviation distance and yaw angle relative to the runway axis.

During the landing rollout phase, if the link anomaly exceeds 75 frames, the system should automatically enter the landing rollout phase and correct the aircraft's lateral deviation and yaw angle relative to the runway axis through the rudder and brakes.

During the landing rollout phase, the system should be capable of real-time monitoring the aircraft's lateral deviation and yaw angle, and make real-time corrections based on the monitoring results to ensure the aircraft taxis along the runway centerline.
During the landing rollout phase, the system should correctly handle the control logic of the rudder and brakes to ensure their coordinated operation and prevent conflicts or incorrect operations.

After the system recovers from power failure or the runaway reset mechanism is activated, it should be able to return to normal operating status and re-enter the landing rollout phase, continuing to correct the aircraft's lateral deviation and yaw angle.

The system should be able to correctly handle different input values, including normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values during control calculations, ensuring the accuracy and validity of the calculation results.

The system should correctly perform control calculations under different states and operational phases, taking into account the influence of operational phases and states to ensure the correctness and validity of the calculation results.

During the execution of system status, if a power failure and subsequent software restart occur, the system should be able to correctly recover the status and continue executing the control logic of the landing rollout phase, ensuring the safety of the aircraft.
The system should coordinate with the hardware in terms of control sequence and timing to ensure completeness and consistency of control conditions, avoiding conflicts or erroneous operations.

requirement: The system should control the aircraft to enter the glide phase after engine shutdown during flight.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that during the descent phase, the control sequence and timing for entering the descent segment after an in-flight engine shutdown are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions.
When the system is performing hover phase control, it should be equipped with a power failure recovery or runaway reset mechanism to ensure recovery to a normal operating state in case of anomalies.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring control safety during the descent phase.
The system should check functional inputs and analyze the correctness of functional processing in different operational phases and states to ensure control accuracy during the descent phase.

The system should check the control solution results and analyze the correctness of functional processing under different conditions (e.g., normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values) to ensure control reliability during the descent phase.
The system should monitor the aircraft status and control outputs during the descent phase to ensure timely response and correction in case of anomalies, preventing accidents.

requirement: The remote control input corresponds to the rudder surface deflection command and throttle deflection command. The linear correspondence between the rudder deflection and throttle command with the remote control input is as follows: δz (-28º~+28º), δx (-20º~+20º), δy (-25º~+25º), δp (0~115%). The limit range is [-30°, +20°].
safety_requirements: The system should check the rudder surface deflection command and throttle lever displacement command corresponding to the remote control input, ensuring they are within the specified linear correspondence range (δz: -28º~+28º, δx: -20º~+20º, δy: -25º~+25º, δp: 0~115%), and comply with the amplitude limit range [-30°, +20°].

The system should monitor the control solution results in real-time, analyze and handle situations such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", to ensure consistency between remote control commands and control surface deflection angles as well as throttle commands.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of controls are coordinated with the hardware, control conditions are complete and consistent, to avoid safety issues caused by sequence or timing errors.

The system should clearly define the sensor acquisition range (upper and lower limits). When sensor readings exceed the acquisition range, the system should be able to correctly identify and report a sensor fault, preventing erroneous data from affecting system safety.

The system should define reasonable ranges for the rate of parameter changes (upper and lower slope limits). For data exceeding the slope range, the system should have clear handling strategies to ensure stability and safety under all operating conditions and phases.

The system should adopt corresponding control resolution processes according to different operating statuses and phases, check and analyze functional inputs to ensure that the system can still properly handle functions and maintain safe operation under conditions such as "unconsidered operation phase" or "unconsidered operating status".

requirement: Elevator control (0-255), aileron control (0-255), rudder control (0-255), throttle control (0-255).
safety_requirements: The rate of change in elevator, aileron, rudder, and throttle control inputs should remain within reasonable limits. Data exceeding these limits should have a clearly defined handling strategy to ensure system stability and safety.

The system shall perform real-time checks on the control calculation results of elevator, aileron, rudder, and throttle inputs, and take corresponding measures to ensure system safety and stability when the analysis results indicate normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values.

The system should be capable of identifying and handling different redundancies in various operational states, ensuring that system functions can still be correctly implemented without faults or safety hazards when two or more redundancies are in different states simultaneously.

The system should employ different control resolution processes according to varying operating statuses and phases, ensuring that under all operating conditions, the control resolution results of elevator, aileron, rudder, and throttle inputs are accurate and reliable, meeting the requirements for system safety and stability.

The system shall check the input control amounts for elevator, aileron, rudder, and throttle, and analyze the correctness of system function processing without considering the operational phase or status, to ensure that the system can maintain safety and stability under all circumstances.

requirement: By means of remote control switch commands, the aileron and elevator deflections are attenuated to two-thirds of the aforementioned values respectively, thereby changing the relationships to: δz (-20º~+20º), δx (-13º~+13º), δy (-25º~+25º), δp (0~115%).
safety_requirements: The system should check the impact of remote control switch commands on aileron and elevator deflection attenuation, ensuring that the calculated values of δz, δx, δy, and δp are within the specified ranges (δz: -20º~+20º, δx: -13º~+13º, δy: -25º~+25º, δp: 0~115%).

The system should monitor the rate of parameter changes, ensure it remains within reasonable limits (upper and lower slope bounds), and have a clear handling strategy for data exceeding these slope limits.

The system should check the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as 'normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values', and ensure the correct execution of remote switch commands.
The system shall check the sensor measurement range to ensure it is within the specified upper and lower limits, and report a sensor fault when the measured value exceeds the measurement range.

The system should check functional inputs according to different states and operational phases, analyzing the correctness of functional handling in cases such as 'operational phase not considered' or 'operational state not considered', to ensure correct execution of remote switch commands under various states.

The system should check the continuous output data values of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of functional implementation when two or more redundant output data values are inconsistent (i.e., their difference exceeds the specified threshold), and ensure the correct execution of remote switch commands.

requirement: Control range and accuracy requirements for elevator control (0–255), aileron control (0–255), rudder control (0–255), and throttle control (0–255)
safety_requirements: The system should check the control range and accuracy of elevator, aileron, rudder, and throttle movements to ensure they are within the specified range (0～255) and meet accuracy requirements, preventing safety issues caused by out-of-range conditions or insufficient accuracy.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the control calculation results, analyze and handle situations such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values" to ensure the correctness and safety of functional processing.

The system should check the data bit value accuracy of the interface data to ensure it meets the accuracy requirements, preventing safety issues caused by data bit value accuracy being greater than or less than the required accuracy.

The system should perform control calculations based on different states and operational phases, ensuring correct functional input, considering the operational phase and state, and preventing errors in functional processing under conditions such as "operational phase not considered" or "state not considered".

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of controls are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and prevent safety issues caused by errors in control sequence or timing.

requirement: When the aircraft is in the ground waiting phase, the elevator deflection command, aileron deflection command, and rudder deflection command are all set to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system shall automatically check and ensure that the elevator deflection command, aileron deflection command, and rudder deflection command are all set to 0° during the aircraft ground waiting phase, and these settings shall not be altered due to human operational errors.

The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities, immediately triggering a warning mechanism and blocking execution of the command upon detecting any illegal or dangerous control instructions, ensuring aircraft safety.

The system shall be able to identify and adapt to different operating conditions during the aircraft ground waiting phase, ensuring that elevator deflection command, aileron deflection command, and rudder deflection command settings always meet the requirements of the current state.

The system shall have the capability to check state transition logic. When the aircraft state changes, the system shall automatically verify that the elevator deflection command, aileron deflection command, and rudder deflection command are correctly set and consistent with the new state.

requirement: To smooth the data and prevent sudden jumps, the data needs to be softened (faded in/out).
safety_requirements: When the system performs data smoothing, it should ensure sufficient capacity of the receiving buffer to prevent data overflow, which could lead to inaccurate output results.

The system should have a data overrun handling mechanism. When the output data exceeds the preset threshold, the system should be able to automatically truncate or output a safety value to prevent sudden data jumps.
When the system performs data softening, it should be able to detect and handle discrete range variations in interface data, ensuring continuity and accuracy of the output results.
During the system's data processing, division by zero should be avoided. If unavoidable, there should be a clear handling strategy to prevent system failures.
The system's parameter variation rate should be within a reasonable range, and there should be a clear strategy for handling excessive slope data to prevent system instability or inaccurate outputs.
The system should be capable of monitoring and controlling the data softening process, ensuring smoothness and continuity of the output data, and preventing data spikes or distortion.

requirement: During the softening time, a weighted average of the old and new values is calculated to obtain the softened value: Softened value = Old value × (1 - t / Softening time limit) + New value × t / Softening time limit.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the weighting process of old and new values during the softening time to ensure accurate calculation of the softened value, and trigger an alarm mechanism in case of calculation errors.

The system shall perform real-time validation of the old and new values during the softening period to ensure they are within the expected range, and that the softened value meets the specified accuracy requirements.

The system should be capable of detecting and handling setting errors or failures in the softening time limit, ensuring the correctness and stability of the softening algorithm, and taking compensatory measures when issues occur.

The system should be able to track and record key data during the softening process when executing the softening algorithm, including old values, new values, softened values, and the softening time limit, facilitating post-analysis and debugging.

The system should be able to automatically detect whether the softened value is within the expected range. If it exceeds the range, the system should automatically adjust the softening parameters or take other corrective actions to ensure the system's stability and safety.

The system should be capable of monitoring the rate of parameter changes during the softening process and automatically trigger adjustment mechanisms when the rate exceeds specified upper or lower limits to maintain system stability and safety.

requirement: The softening method for initial values of the integrator is specifically used to provide softened attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) and throttle command during phase switching in control laws containing integrators.
safety_requirements: During phase transitions, the system should check the smoothing process of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) and throttle commands to ensure that the integrator initial value smoothing method correctly achieves state transition and control computation under different states and operational phases.

The system should perform real-time monitoring and checking of state transition conditions to ensure that the setting and fulfillment of transition conditions can be correctly identified and handled during the state transition process, preventing state transition errors or anomalies.

The system should be capable of correctly executing the functional control solution process under different states and operational phases, taking into account variations between operational phases and states, to ensure correctness and consistency of functional inputs and outputs.

The system should be able to correctly check and handle state entry conditions, and during state execution, it should identify and respond to the satisfaction, non-satisfaction, or re-satisfaction of entry conditions, ensuring the correctness and safety of state execution.

The system should be capable of real-time monitoring and checking control solution results. It should correctly handle and respond to situations where the analysis results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, thereby preventing system faults or anomalies.

The system should correctly manage different functions with assigned priorities when operating in two or more states involving transitions, ensuring that high-priority functions can properly override low-priority functions, preventing priority conflicts or state confusion.

requirement: When switching to a control law with an integrator, in order to achieve a smooth transition of the corresponding reference attitude angle Jg or Yg or yg, instead of simply setting the initial value of the integrator in the next control law phase to zero, the initial value of the integrator is calculated by setting the reference attitude angle of the next phase equal to that of the previous phase.
safety_requirements: When the system switches to a control law with an integrator, the initial values of the given attitude angles Jg or Yg or yg should be checked to ensure smooth transition and prevent system instability or incorrect control outputs.

The system should verify the control solution process under different states and operational phases to ensure its correctness and consistency, avoiding erroneous control outputs caused by state or phase transitions.

When the system transitions between two or more states, the transition conditions should be checked to ensure correctness and reasonableness of state transitions, avoiding system instability or incorrect control outputs caused by state transition errors.

The system should perform real-time monitoring and checking of the control solution results to ensure they remain within normal ranges, avoiding system instability or incorrect control outputs caused by abnormal or boundary values.

When the system switches between functions with assigned priorities, the priority relationships should be checked to ensure that high-priority functions are not interfered by low-priority ones, avoiding system instability or incorrect control outputs caused by priority conflicts.

The system should monitor the entry conditions in real time to ensure their satisfaction during state execution, avoiding system instability or incorrect control outputs caused by unsatisfied entry conditions.

requirement: At the transition from the takeoff departure segment to climb segment 1, let Jg be the calculated reference pitch angle at the moment just before switching from the takeoff departure segment to climb segment 1, and let x be the initial value of the airspeed integrator. Then x is calculated as follows: x = Jg - Kv [nk (k) - ng (k)] / K vI
safety_requirements: When the system switches between the takeoff departure segment and climb phase 1, it should check the operational phase and operating status of the functional inputs to ensure accurate calculation results for the specified pitch angle Jg and the initial value x of the airspeed integrator, in accordance with the current operational phase and operating status.

The system should perform real-time checks on the calculated initial value x of the airspeed integrator, analyze whether its value is normal, abnormal, at a boundary, or an extreme maximum/minimum value, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should check the data bit value precision of the interface data to ensure it is greater than or equal to the required precision. When the data bit value precision is insufficient, the system should be able to handle it correctly and output a warning message.

When the system switches from a high-priority function to a low-priority function, it should ensure the correctness of states and functions, preventing incorrect state transitions and function executions. When switching from a low-priority function to a high-priority function, the system should also handle the transition correctly and ensure the correctness of states and functions.

The system should be capable of detecting and processing functional control resolution processes under different operational phases and states, ensuring the accuracy and correctness of the resolution results, and preventing functional failures or incorrect executions caused by errors in operational phases or states.

requirement: Softening of the two height type data during height type switching.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure correct soft processing of the two altitude type data during high-type switching, to avoid data conflicts or loss.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of interface data during the process of switching between high-type interfaces, check the correctness of data values when switching between different output equivalence classes, and trigger the safety warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should limit the time required for switching height types, ensuring that the switching time remains within the allowable range to prevent system instability caused by excessively long switching times.

The system should monitor the rate of parameter changes during the high-type switching process to ensure that the parameter variations remain within reasonable limits and apply clear handling strategies for data exceeding these limits.

The system should correctly switch between different functions according to the set priorities during the height type switching process, ensuring that high-priority functions are executed before low-priority ones, and maintaining system stability during the switching process.

requirement: Softening of rudder deflection command and throttle valve deflection command during switching with remote control of control surfaces.
safety_requirements: When the system switches to remote control of the control surfaces, it should ensure that during the softening process of the control surface deflection command and throttle deflection command, the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after, and the hardware status is coordinated with the software control sequence and timing.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring stability and safety during the remote control switching process of the control surfaces.

The system should limit the rate of change of rudder command and throttle command within reasonable ranges (upper and lower slope limits), and define handling strategies for data exceeding these slope limits, to prevent instability caused by rapid parameter changes.

The system should be capable of properly handling situations where the redundancy switching conditions are met but the switch fails, including measures such as recording faults, triggering early warning mechanisms, and attempting to re-switch, to ensure system safety and reliability.

The system should be capable of monitoring and handling situations where redundancy switching takes excessive time, including measures such as recording delays, triggering warning mechanisms, and optimizing the switching process, to ensure the system's timeliness and safety.

requirement: When the flight altitude is greater than 150m, the landing gear compression signal is false, and the flight phase is not greater than the descent phase, the stage transition is performed according to the DH value.
safety_requirements: The system should perform phase transitions based on the DH value when the flight altitude is greater than 150m, the landing gear compressed signal is false, and the flight phase is not beyond the descent phase, ensuring correctness and safety during the transition process.

The system should check functional inputs under different states and operational phases, analyze the correctness of functional processing without considering the operational phase or state, and ensure the correctness of the functional control solution process.

The system should check the control solution results of the functions, analyze the correctness of functional processing when the control solution results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and ensure the results are within the expected range.

The system should set different priorities for functions under two or more states with transition relationships, check the correctness of states and functions when switching between high and low priority levels, and ensure the safety of state transitions.

The system should clearly define the sensor's measurement range (upper and lower limits) and report a sensor fault when the measured value exceeds this range, ensuring the reliability and safety of the sensor data.

When the system transitions between operational states, it should check the values of functional interface data, analyze the correctness of outputs when values or value ranges change, and ensure the accuracy and safety of output results.

requirement: Longitudinal control law: δz = KJ (J - Jg) + Kwz · wz
safety_requirements: When the system calculates the longitudinal control law δz = KJ (J-Jg) + Kwz · wz, it should check whether the control solution result is a normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, or maximum/minimum value, and ensure correct functional handling in different situations.

The system should check functional inputs according to different operational states and phases, analyze the correctness of functional processing without considering the operational phase or state, and ensure the correctness of the control solution process.

The control sequence and timing of the system shall be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions shall be complete and consistent to ensure the correct control sequence and timing of the system.
The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships among the control logic of each functional point, avoiding logical conflicts or errors.

The system shall detect whether the control solution process times out (fails to return a result within the specified time) when calculating the longitudinal control law δz = KJ (J-Jg) + Kwz · wz, and shall trigger a warning mechanism or take appropriate measures in case of timeout.

The system should monitor and check the longitudinal control law δz = KJ (J-Jg) + Kwz. wz calculation results in real time to ensure their accuracy and consistency, and provide alerts or automatic adjustments when anomalies occur.

requirement: Softening of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) during autonomous-to-remote attitude control transition and remote-to-autonomous attitude control transition.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the smoothing process of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) when autonomously switching to attitude remote control and when switching from attitude remote control to autonomous mode, ensuring correct execution under transition conditions to prevent state confusion.

The system should check the transition conditions between every two states in the software state space, analyze the correctness of state transitions under conditions such as "not set, always satisfied, never satisfied", and ensure that the attitude angle smoothing process is not affected.

When the system transitions between operational states, the values of functional interface data should be checked to analyze the correctness of outputs in situations such as "value changes or range of values changes," and ensure the accuracy of the softening results for given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg).

The system should check and analyze the correctness of states and functions in cases such as "switching from high priority to low priority, switching from low priority to high priority," etc., when two or more states with transition relationships exist and different functions have been assigned priorities, and shall ensure that the softening process of attitude angles is correctly executed.

The system shall check functional inputs under different states and operational phases, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases such as "operational phase not considered" or "state not considered", and ensure the softening process for given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) is properly handled.

The system shall check the state entry conditions, analyze the correctness of state execution under conditions such as "satisfied, not satisfied, satisfied again" during state execution, and ensure that the attitude angle smoothing process is correctly triggered.

requirement: Smoothing of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) during the transition from rotation to landing rollout phase, and smoothing of the given attitude angles (Yg, yg) and throttle deflection command during transitions between other phases.
safety_requirements: During the rollout phase after touchdown, the system should verify whether the smoothing of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg) is correct, ensuring that the attitude angles (Yg, yg) and the throttle command smoothing during transition meet the expected criteria.

During the transition to landing roll phase, the system should monitor the softening process of the given attitude angles (Jg, Yg, yg), analyze the compatibility of states before and after softening, and ensure the correctness of state transition.

The system should check the state transition conditions during the landing rollout phase and other phases, analyze the correctness of state transitions under conditions such as "not set, always satisfied, unachievable," and ensure the reliability of state transitions.

When the system transitions between operational states, the values of functional interface data should be checked to analyze the correctness of outputs in scenarios such as "value changes or value range changes," ensuring the accuracy of output results.

The system should check the conditions for entering a state, analyze the correctness of state execution under conditions such as "satisfied, not satisfied, satisfied again" during state execution, and ensure the reliability of state execution.

The system should check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation in cases such as "two or more redundancies are in different states," and ensure the integrity of the function.

requirement: Softening of the given pitch angle during phase switching in longitudinal control law with an integrator.
safety_requirements: When the system switches to the phase where the longitudinal control law includes an integrator, the softening process of the pitch angle should be checked to ensure its sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent.

The system should limit the rate of change of the pitch angle during the softening process within reasonable ranges (upper and lower slope limits) and have a clear strategy for handling data that exceeds these slope limits.

The system should output the control status at the appropriate time that meets the scenario requirements, and correctly handle functional inputs during the control resolution process under different states and operation phases.

When the system performs state transitions, it should check the transition conditions, analyze the correctness of state transitions under scenarios such as 'condition not set, always satisfied, never satisfied', and ensure the accuracy of state transitions.
The system should monitor the pitch angle softening process when switching to the phase with an integrator in the longitudinal control law, and trigger a warning mechanism if any abnormality occurs.

requirement: Smoothing of throttle deflection commands during transition from climb to altitude hold and from descent to altitude hold. The initial value of the throttle control integrator is directly set to 100.0 during transition from climb to altitude hold, and directly set to 50.0 during transition from descent to altitude hold.
safety_requirements: During the transition from climbing to altitude hold and descending to altitude hold, the softening of throttle deflection commands should follow a reasonable range of change rates, and there should be clear handling strategies for data exceeding this range.

The system should check the state transition conditions when switching from climbing to altitude hold and from descending to altitude hold, ensuring the correctness and consistency of the transition conditions to prevent state transition errors.

When the operating status is transferred, the system should check the values of the functional interface data to ensure correctness and consistency of outputs in cases where the value or value range changes.

The system should check the control calculation results to ensure the correctness and effectiveness of functional processing when the results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values.
The sequence and timing of system control should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to prevent control errors or conflicts.

The system should monitor the initial value of the throttle control integrator when transitioning from climbing to altitude hold and from descending to altitude hold, ensuring the initial value remains within the preset range to prevent integrator overflow or failure.

requirement: When switching from attitude remote control to autonomous mode, the longitudinal control integrator is reset to zero. If it is a fixed-altitude phase, the initial value of the throttle control integrator is directly set to 50.0.
safety_requirements: When the system switches from attitude remote control to autonomous mode, it should verify the correctness of longitudinal control integrator reset, ensuring that the integrator reset does not affect system stability and control accuracy.
During the system's altitude hold phase, check whether the initial value of the throttle control integrator is correctly set to 50.0 to ensure control accuracy and stability of the system.

The system should perform real-time checks on the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should perform control calculations based on different working stages and states, check whether the function inputs are correct, and analyze the correctness of function handling in cases such as "unconsidered working stage" or "unconsidered working state," to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should check whether the sequence and timing of controls are coordinated with the hardware, and whether control conditions are complete and consistent, to ensure safety and reliability of the system.

The system should implement timeout detection for critical controls or actions to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring system safety and reliability.

When a software power failure and restart occur during the system state execution, the state after restart should be checked, and the correctness of state execution should be analyzed in cases such as 'state not restored' and 'error recovery' after restart, to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: The softening of the elevator deflection command during the transition from climbing to level flight is performed using two softening methods simultaneously, whereas the softening of the elevator deflection command during the transition from descending to level flight employs only the integrator initial value softening method.
safety_requirements: During the transition from climb to altitude hold, the system should ensure the correctness of throttle command smoothing during the simultaneous execution of both softening methods, including the accuracy of the softening algorithm and the real-time performance of the softening process.

When descending to a fixed altitude, the system should ensure the correctness of the throttle command smoothing using only the integrator initial value softening method, including the rationality of the integrator initial value and the real-time performance during the softening process.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the softening process for throttle deviation commands, analyze the effectiveness of the softening methods and the fulfillment of transition conditions, to ensure the correctness and safety of state transitions.

The system should limit the rate of change of the throttle deviation command to ensure that the rate remains within a reasonable range, and implement corresponding handling strategies when the range is exceeded to prevent system instability.

The system should manage functions of different priorities to ensure the normal execution of high-priority functions without interference from low-priority functions, thereby guaranteeing the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should check the implementation of functions under different operating conditions, analyze the functional correctness when two or more redundancies are in different states, and ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: In order to suppress sensor noise and external interference with the sensor output data, it is necessary to perform filtering on some of the input sensor data.
safety_requirements: The system shall perform real-time filtering on the input sensor data to effectively suppress noise and external interference, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the data.
The filtering algorithm should be capable of adapting to different types of sensor data and noise patterns, ensuring optimal and stable filtering performance.

The system should monitor the real-time performance of the filtering process to ensure that it does not have an unacceptable impact on the system's real-time response, and make adjustments or optimizations as necessary.

The system should be capable of detecting and responding to status changes in external devices (such as sensors, NVM, databases, other systems, etc.), ensuring that accurate and reliable outputs are provided even when these devices are in a degraded or maintenance state.

The system should have self-diagnostic and alarm functions, which can promptly trigger the early warning mechanism and notify maintenance personnel for inspection and handling when abnormalities occur in the filtering process or external device status.

requirement: A prefilter is used to filter the input data. The filter's cutoff frequency wc is transformed using the Tustin bilinear transformation to obtain the filtering formula y(k) = a0y(k-1) + a1[x(k)+x(k-1)], where a0 and a1 take different values depending on wc.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the cutoff frequency wc of the pre-filter is set appropriately to prevent excessive suppression of valid signals by the filter, which may lead to data distortion.

The system shall perform real-time monitoring of input data, and automatically enable filtering and debouncing processing upon detecting interfering data, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the data.
The system should dynamically adjust the filter parameters according to different working states and stages, ensuring the correctness and real-time performance of the filtering process.

The system should evaluate the impact of filtering processing on real-time performance, ensuring that filtering processing does not cause a decrease in system real-time capability, thereby affecting normal system operation.

The system should have a detection and alarm mechanism for filter processing faults. When a filter processing fault occurs, the system should be able to automatically switch to a backup mode or generate an alarm signal to ensure system safety and reliability.

requirement: Different wc values are selected for different sensor data, and the corresponding a0 and a1 also vary; see Table 3-21 for specific parameters.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the sensor's measurement range is clearly defined, including upper and lower limits, and report a sensor fault when the measurement exceeds the defined range.

The system should check the data bit value accuracy of the interface data to ensure it meets the accuracy requirements, and output the correct result when the data bit value accuracy is greater than or less than the required accuracy.
The system should check the control solution results to ensure correct functional processing under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values.
The system should be able to handle inconsistencies in the same input data values received with different redundancies, ensuring the correctness of function implementation.
The system should select appropriate wc, a0, and a1 parameters based on different sensor data to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the calculation results.

requirement: Compensate the vertical speed from the radio altimeter and the atmospheric altimeter using the inertial navigation vertical acceleration to improve their accuracy.
safety_requirements: The system should check the calculation process of the radio altimeter's rate of climb/descent and the atmospheric engine's rate of climb/descent, ensuring that the inertial navigation vertical acceleration compensation is correct under different redundancy operating conditions, and that the output results are accurate.

The system should monitor the rate of change of both the radio altimeter vertical speed and the atmospheric altimeter vertical speed, ensuring they remain within reasonable limits, and implement predefined handling strategies when exceeding these limits.

The system shall perform real-time monitoring on data bits with continuous value ranges in the interface data, analyze the difference between data values across multiple cycles, and if the difference exceeds the specified threshold, trigger the slope fault handling mechanism.

The system should check the output accuracy of the radio altimeter's climb/descent rate and the atmospheric altimeter's climb/descent rate, ensure that it meets the accuracy requirements, and take appropriate corrective actions when the accuracy is insufficient.

The system shall perform functional self-tests under different operating conditions, especially when two or more redundancies are in different states, to ensure the normal operation of the inertial navigation vertical acceleration compensation function for radio altimeter climb/descent rate and atmospheric unit climb/descent rate, and to guarantee reliable output results.

requirement: Lateral control law: δx = KY · (Y - Yg)
safety_requirements: When the system is performing lateral control, it should check the input values and parameters of the δx calculation formula KY·(Y - Yg), ensuring that the calculated results are accurate under normal operating conditions and meet the system's control requirements.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the calculation results for δx, analyze whether their values are within the expected range, and trigger corresponding early warning and handling mechanisms when abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme values occur.

The system's control logic should ensure the correct timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships between the calculation of δx and other functional points, avoiding system instability or failures caused by logic errors.

The system should adjust the calculation process of δx according to different working states and phases, ensuring the functional control solution process is correct under each state and phase, and supplementing handling for cases where working phases or states are not considered.

The system should set a reasonable range for the rate of change of δx (upper and lower slope limits) and define data handling strategies for values exceeding this range to ensure system stability and safety.

The system should monitor the values of KY and (Y - Yg) in real time, ensuring they remain within the expected range, and provide alerts and take corrective actions in case of anomalies to prevent inaccurate δx calculation from affecting the control performance of the system.

requirement: The method of implementing combined filtering includes reading inertial navigation vertical acceleration data and applying it to compensation calculations for radio altimeter and atmospheric engine lift-off speed.
safety_requirements: The system should be able to detect inconsistencies in the same input data values received through different redundancy channels, and automatically switch to a reliable data source to ensure the correctness of the combined filtering.

The system must perform real-time filtering and anti-jitter processing on the inertial navigation vertical acceleration data, effectively shielding interference data to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the calculation results.

The system should evaluate the impact of filtering processing on real-time performance and ensure that this impact remains within an acceptable range, without causing significant effects on overall system performance.

The system should have the capability to automatically monitor the filtering processing effect, and be able to promptly issue warning signals to alert the system administrator for intervention and correction when the filtering processing fails or abnormalities occur.

requirement: The system needs to compensate for the atmospheric unit's lifting speed based on vertical acceleration.
safety_requirements: When the system compensates for the lifting speed of the atmospheric machine, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, control conditions are complete and consistent, to avoid safety hazards caused by errors in sequence or timing.

The system shall monitor the rate of change of vertical acceleration and set reasonable upper and lower slope limits. When the rate exceeds this range, the system shall implement predefined handling strategies to prevent unstable conditions from occurring.

The system should have a clear fault recovery mechanism, enabling it to automatically switch to a safe state or enter a fault protection mode in case of a failure, ensuring the system's safety and reliability.

The system should make corresponding judgments and take necessary measures to ensure stability and safety when encountering abnormal external factors (such as high sea conditions, severe weather conditions, etc.).

For critical controls or actions, the system should implement a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where hardware status cannot meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing safety risks caused by the system remaining in an indeterminate state for too long.

requirement: The system needs to compensate for the vertical acceleration of the radio altimeter's rising and falling speed.
