safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and that control conditions are complete and consistent when performing vertical acceleration compensation for radio altimeter altitude rate. This avoids inaccurate calculation results caused by errors in sequence or timing.

The system should set reasonable ranges (upper and lower slope limits) for vertical acceleration and the rate of change of radio altimeter climb/descent speed, and define data processing strategies for values exceeding these ranges, ensuring calculation accuracy and system stability.

The system needs to perform real-time checks on data bits with continuous value ranges in the interface data, analyze whether the difference between data values across multiple cycles exceeds the specified threshold (i.e., slope fault), and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies to ensure output correctness.

The system should monitor the communication status of interface data frames, analyze the correctness of outputs in cases such as "data frame loss," and implement measures to ensure reliable data transmission and processing, avoiding inaccurate computational results caused by data loss or errors.

The system should clearly define the acquisition range (upper and lower limits) of the sensor, and set up an alarm mechanism for values exceeding the acquisition range. When the sensor's acquired value exceeds the specified range, the system should report a sensor fault to ensure data accuracy and reliability.

requirement: The system needs to use the Tustin bilinear transform to obtain a unified filter formula.
safety_requirements: When the system employs the Tustin bilinear transformation, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent, avoiding system instability or faults caused by sequence or timing errors.

When the system is performing data acquisition, it should carry out filtering and anti-jitter processing to effectively shield interference data, ensuring the collected data is accurate and reliable, avoiding system instability or failure caused by data errors.

The system shall perform real-time monitoring of the collected data, checking whether the data bit value precision meets the required precision. When the data bit value precision exceeds the required precision, the system shall be able to handle and output it correctly, avoiding system instability or failure caused by data precision issues.

The system should set reasonable ranges for parameter change rates (including upper and lower limits of the slope). When the parameter change rate exceeds the set range, the system should have a clear handling strategy to avoid system instability or failure caused by abnormal parameter change rates.

When the system processes data, it should check the value accuracy of the interface data bits, analyze the correctness of the output in cases where the value accuracy of the data bits is higher than the required accuracy, and ensure the accuracy and reliability of the output results.

requirement: The system needs to calculate the values of H1(k) and Hbc(k).
safety_requirements: When calculating the values of H1(k) and Hbc(k), the system should check the timing of the interface data to ensure correctness of the output when the input timing corresponds to a maximum or minimum value.

When the system calculates the values of H1(k) and Hbc(k), it shall check the control solution results to ensure the correctness of functional processing when the control solution result is a normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, or extreme maximum/minimum value.

When the system calculates the values of H1(k) and Hbc(k), it should check the data bit value precision of the interface data to ensure correctness of the output when the data bit value precision is higher than the required precision.

When calculating the values of H1(k) and Hbc(k), the system should check the data bit value precision of the interface data to ensure correctness of the output when the data bit value precision is less than the required precision.

When calculating the values of H1(k) and Hbc(k), the system should check the cycle of interface data to ensure correctness of the output when the input value cycle is greater than, less than, or at extreme maximum or minimum values of the specified cycle.

The system shall perform real-time consistency checks on the calculated values of H1(k) and Hbc(k) to ensure they match the expected results, and trigger an early warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: When H is taken as Hb and Hr respectively, the system needs to calculate the compensated lifting and lowering speed Hbc corresponding to uy and h.
safety_requirements: When the system calculates the compensated lifting and lowering speed Hbc, it should check whether the control solution result is a normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, or maximum/minimum value, and ensure correct functional handling under different scenarios, especially when H is taken as Hb and Hr respectively.

The system should check functional inputs according to different operating statuses and stages, analyze the correctness of functional processing without considering the operating stage or status, and ensure that the calculated lifting speed Hbc correctly corresponds to uy and h.

When the system calculates the compensated lifting and lowering speed Hbc, it should check whether the value accuracy of the interface data meets the required precision. When the data value accuracy is greater than or less than the required precision, the system should be able to handle it correctly and output the result.

The system should check whether the cycle of interface data conforms to the specified cycle. When the input value cycle is greater than or less than the specified cycle, or when extreme maximum or minimum values occur, the system should be able to handle them correctly and output results, ensuring the accuracy of the calculated rate of change Hbc.

The system should be able to correctly calculate the compensated lifting and lowering speed Hbc under different states and operation phases, and ensure the correctness and consistency of output results, especially in the calculation of uy and h when H is taken as Hb and Hr respectively.

requirement: The system needs to calculate the values of H1(k) and H2(k) according to the formula at each sampling cycle T=20ms.
safety_requirements: The system shall check the cycle of interface data every sampling period T=20ms to ensure that the input value cycle is the specified cycle and that the output values H1(k) and H2(k) are correct.

The system should perform a matching check on the transmission and reception cycles of interface data to ensure consistency between the transmission and reception cycles, avoiding data loss or errors.
The system shall check the timing of interface data at each sampling cycle T=20ms to ensure that the input timing is within the specified time range and the output values H1(k) and H2(k) are correct.
The system should check the duration of the interface data values to ensure that the duration is within the specified time range, and output the correct values of H1(k) and H2(k).
The system should trigger an alarm mechanism in case of abnormal situations (such as early input, late input, maximum values, minimum values, etc.) to ensure the safety and stability of the system.

requirement: Determine the flight phase under autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes.
safety_requirements: The system should be able to correctly determine the flight phase under autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes, and ensure the correctness of functional control solution processes in different states and operational phases.

The system should check the temporal relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combination relationships between functional points to ensure their correctness and consistency.

The system should perform real-time checks on the control calculation results, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control calculation results are "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", and trigger corresponding early warning or error correction mechanisms.
The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of controls are coordinated with the hardware, control conditions are complete and consistent, to avoid safety risks caused by improper control.

The system should perform real-time checks on state entry conditions, analyze the correctness of state execution when entry conditions are "satisfied, not satisfied, satisfied again" during execution, and make adjustments or issue warnings according to actual conditions.
The system should be capable of detecting and responding to changes in flight phases, and adjusting control strategies according to the new flight phase to ensure safety and stability of the system.

requirement: The determination of the flight phase under remote control mode (with or without inner loop remote control) is different accordingly.
safety_requirements: When the system is in remote control mode, it should perform corresponding control calculations according to different flight phases to ensure the correctness and effectiveness of functional input, avoiding errors caused by neglecting the working phase or operational status.

The system shall ensure that the sequence and timing of controls are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and avoid system failures caused by prolonged inability of hardware status to meet control requirements.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to ensure that critical controls or actions are completed within the specified time, avoiding system failures caused by hardware states failing to meet control requirements for an extended period.
The system should ensure that the timing of output control status meets scenario requirements, avoiding system failures or safety hazards caused by improper output timing.

The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships among the control logic of each functional point, to avoid system failures or safety hazards caused by logical relationship errors.

When the system is in remote control mode, it should be capable of real-time monitoring and adjusting control parameters to ensure system stability and safety, avoiding system failures or safety hazards caused by parameter maladjustment.

requirement: When switching between control modes, perform corresponding processing and phase determination.
safety_requirements: When the system switches control modes, it should perform corresponding processing and phase determination to ensure the correct functional control resolution process under different states and operational phases, and be able to handle situations of 'unconsidered operational phases' or 'unconsidered operational states'.

The system shall check functional inputs, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as 'unconsidered operational phase' or 'unconsidered operating status', and ensure the correctness of functional processing when the control calculation results are 'normal value', 'abnormal value', 'boundary value', or 'extreme maximum/minimum value'.

The sequence and timing of system control should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the correctness of timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combination relationships among control logic points.

The system should implement timeout checks for critical controls or actions to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, and ensure the system's behavior remains predictable and safe under such circumstances.

The system should be capable of detecting and handling abnormal situations during the control mode switching process, such as mode switch failure, timeout, etc., and should be able to automatically recover to a safe state or prompt the user to take appropriate actions.

requirement: Lateral control law: δy = KyY · (Y - Yg) + Kywy · wy
safety_requirements: The system should check the input parameters of the lateral control law δy = KyY·(Y - Yg) + Kywy·wy to ensure their consistency and correctness during computation, especially during transitions between operating modes or hardware coordination.

The system should perform real-time monitoring on the calculation results of the lateral control law δy = KyY·(Y - Yg) + Kywy·wy, analyze the correctness of handling under conditions such as 'normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum/minimum value', and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormal situations.

The system shall ensure that the lateral control law δy = KyY·(Y - Yg) + Kywy·wy correctly maintains the timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships with other functional points, and accurately performs control calculations under different states or operational phases.

The system should check whether the input parameters of the lateral control law δy = KyY. (Y - Yg) + Kywy. wy take into account the operational phase and operational status, and analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the 'operational phase' or 'operational status' is not considered.

The system should verify whether the variation rate of parameters in the lateral control law δy = KyY·(Y - Yg) + Kywy·wy is within a reasonable range (upper and lower slope limits), and ensure that the handling strategy for over-slope data is clear and effective.

requirement: Smoothing of given attitude angles, control surface commands, or throttle during flight phase transitions and control mode switches.
safety_requirements: The system should smooth the given attitude angles, control surface commands, or throttle inputs during flight phase transitions and control mode switches, ensuring correctness and consistency of the smoothing process to prevent flight attitude instability or control failure caused by smoothing errors.

The system shall check the functional inputs during flight phase transitions and control mode switches, analyze the correctness of functional processing in scenarios such as "work phase not considered" and "operational status not considered," to ensure the validity and rationality of functional inputs.

The sequence and timing of system control should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the correct execution of control commands and the accuracy of timing.

The system should check the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control solution results are "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values," etc., to ensure the validity and reliability of the control solution results.

During state execution, after a power failure and subsequent software restart, the system should check the state after restarting, analyze the correctness of state execution in cases such as "state not restored" or "error recovery" after restarting, and ensure correct state recovery and consistency.

The system should check the transition conditions between every pair of states in the software state space, analyze the correctness of state transitions under conditions such as "not set, always satisfied, never satisfied," and ensure the rationality and effectiveness of state transitions.

requirement: Select two softening methods: one for softening during switching between control modes with inner loops or flight phase transitions, and another for softening during switching of remote control modes without inner loops.
safety_requirements: When the system switches control modes or flight phases, it should correctly select the softening method and ensure that it matches the current state and operating phase to prevent functional abnormalities caused by inappropriate softening methods.

The system shall check functional inputs and analyze the correctness of functional processing under different states and operational phases, ensuring that the absence of consideration for operational phases or states does not lead to functional anomalies.

The system shall check the transition conditions between every pair of states in the software state space, analyze the correctness of the transition conditions, and ensure the correctness of state transitions when transition conditions are not set, always satisfied, or never satisfied.

The system should check different functions with assigned priorities, analyze the correctness of states and functions when switching between high and low priority levels under two or more interrelated states, ensuring reasonable priority settings and correct execution.

The system should check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation when two or more redundancies are in different states, and ensure that the functions can be executed correctly under various states and meet safety requirements.

requirement: The flight control system must have a notch filter function to attenuate structural vibration mode signals of the airframe, ensuring system stability.
safety_requirements: The flight control system must have a notch filter function to ensure effective attenuation of the airframe structural vibration mode signals and maintain system stability.

The flight control system must remain coordinated with the hardware devices during control, ensuring completeness and consistency of control conditions to avoid system instability caused by discrepancies in hardware status.

The flight control system must perform filtering and anti-jitter processing on the collected data, effectively shielding interference data to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the collected data.

The flight control system must perform real-time checks on the control solution results, analyze different types of control solution outcomes (e.g., normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values), and ensure the correctness of functional processing and system stability.

The flight control system must be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism. For critical controls or actions, if the hardware status cannot meet the control requirements for an extended period, the system must be able to automatically switch to a backup mode or issue an alarm signal to ensure system safety and reliability.

requirement: The elevator channel in the flight control system should include two notch filters, one located between the control law output and the servo loop, and the other after the vertical acceleration prefilter.
safety_requirements: In the flight control system, the elevator channel of the autopilot should ensure the correct installation positions of two notch filters, one located between the control law output and the actuator loop, and the other located after the elevator acceleration pre-filter, with reasonable filter parameter settings to ensure system stability and responsiveness.

The system should monitor in real-time the signals between the control law output and the actuator loop to detect any abnormal signals or distortions, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the control signals.

The flight control system should have a self-check function to automatically detect the working status of the elevator channel during system startup and operation, including the validity of filters and signal integrity, ensuring system safety and reliability.

The system should dynamically adjust the control parameters of the elevator channel according to different working stages and states to ensure system stability and responsiveness, and trigger a warning mechanism in abnormal situations.
The flight control system should ensure that the timing of output control states meets scenario requirements, including elevator action time and magnitude, to guarantee system safety and reliability.

requirement: The notch filter parameters between the control law output and the actuator loop should be set as x1z = 0.1, x2z = 0.6, wn1z = 24.3, wn2z = 24.3.
safety_requirements: The system should check the settings of the notch filter parameters x1z, x2z, wn1z, and wn2z to ensure their correctness and consistency, in order to avoid system instability caused by incorrect filter parameters.
The system should verify the coordination of notch filter parameters with the hardware device when configuring them, ensuring completeness and consistency of control conditions before and after.
The system should perform boundary value checks on the notch filter parameters to ensure they are within normal ranges, preventing system failures caused by parameter values exceeding the limits.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the control calculation results. When the calculation results are abnormal values or boundary values, the system should be able to automatically trigger a warning mechanism and perform corresponding error handling.

The system should dynamically adjust and optimize the parameters of the notch filter under different states and operational phases to ensure its adaptability to various working conditions and environments.

The system should have self-testing and diagnostic capabilities, enabling status monitoring and health checks of the output circuits without affecting normal output, and promptly alarming and handling any detected issues.

requirement: The specific parameters of the notch filter after the lifting acceleration pre-filter should be configured in the system.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the specific parameter configuration of the notch filter after the lifting acceleration pre-filter is correct and coordinated with the hardware, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent.

The system should monitor in real-time the parameter configuration of the notch filter and determine whether the hardware status matches the control requirements. When a mismatch is detected, the early warning mechanism should be triggered.

The system should limit the rate of change of notch filter parameters within a reasonable range (upper and lower slope limits) and define handling strategies for out-of-slope data to ensure system stability and safety.

The system should check the control solution results of the notch filter, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as 'normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum and minimum values', and ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring the safety and reliability of the system.
The system should record and retain key information such as the notch filter parameter configuration, control solution results, and hardware status for post-analysis and fault diagnosis.

requirement: The vertical acceleration in the longitudinal control law during the flare phase needs to be processed through vertical acceleration notch filter 2.
safety_requirements: The processing of the pitch acceleration notch filter 2 in the longitudinal control law during the flare phase should follow the sequence and timing coordinated with the hardware, ensuring the completeness and consistency of control conditions before and after.

The processing of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2 should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring system stability and safety.

The processing of the pitch acceleration notch filter 2 in the longitudinal control law during the flare phase should be handled according to the corresponding control calculations based on different operational phases and states, ensuring the correctness and effectiveness of the functional input.

The processing results of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2 should be checked in real time, and the control calculation results should be analyzed under conditions of normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values to ensure the correctness and safety of functional processing.

The parameters of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2 should be set within a reasonable rate of change range, including upper and lower slope limits, and a clear handling strategy for out-of-slope data should be established to ensure system stability and safety.

requirement: The notch filter parameters for the aileron channel are x1x = 0.1, x2x = 0.6, wn1x = 24.3, wn2x = 24.3.
safety_requirements: The notch filter parameters x1x, x2x, wn1x, and wn2x of the aileron channel shall be within specified ranges, and their rates of change shall be within reasonable limits. A warning mechanism shall be triggered when these parameters exceed the ranges.

The parameters x1x, x2x, wn1x, and wn2x of the notch filter in the aileron channel should be set according to a clear data processing strategy to ensure the correctness and consistency of data output.

The notch filter of the aileron channel shall check the communication protocol of the interface data frame to ensure that the data length is within the specified range, and an error handling mechanism shall be triggered if the range is exceeded.

The notch filter of the aileron channel shall check the sensor acquisition range to ensure it is within the specified upper and lower limits. A sensor fault shall be reported if the acquisition range is exceeded.

The notch filter of the aileron channel shall check the communication status of the interface data frame, analyze the correctness of outputs in cases such as data frame loss, and ensure the reliability of data output.

The notch filter of the aileron channel should check the receiving buffer of the interface data, analyze the correctness of the output when the receiving buffer capacity is less than the interface data volume, and ensure the integrity of the data output.

requirement: The notch filter parameters for the rudder channel are x1y = 0.1, x2y = 0.5999922, wn1y = 40.81997, wn2y = 25.11991.
safety_requirements: The variation rates of the x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y parameters of the rudder channel notch filter should be within reasonable ranges, and there should be clear handling strategies for data exceeding these ranges.

The calculated results of the notch filter parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y for the rudder channel shall undergo real-time consistency checks to ensure their alignment with expected values and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The acquisition range for the yaw channel notch filter parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y shall be clearly defined, and a sensor fault shall be reported when exceeding the acquisition range.

The calculation of the notch filter parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y for the rudder channel should consider the operational phase and operating conditions to ensure correct control solution process of the function under different states and operational phases.

The filter processing of the yaw channel's notch filter parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y shall ensure real-time performance and must not have an unacceptable impact on the system's real-time capability.

requirement: The discretized notch filter formula obtained using the Tustin bilinear transformation is δd(k) = [- Kd12δd(k-1) - Kd22δd(k-2) + Kd01δ(k) + Kd11δ(k-1) + Kd].
safety_requirements: The system shall perform real-time monitoring on the input data of the discretized notch filter. When a sudden change in values between two consecutive cycle data is detected, the system shall automatically trigger recalculation and adjustment of the filter parameters to ensure accuracy and real-time performance of the filtering results.

After filter processing, the system should be able to monitor in real-time the impact of the filtering results on system real-time performance, and adjust and optimize accordingly based on predefined real-time requirements, ensuring that the filtering process does not cause unacceptable effects on system real-time performance.

The system should be capable of performing real-time inspection and verification of the filtered results to ensure they fall within the expected normal value range, and be able to automatically detect and handle special cases such as abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum or minimum values.

The system should be capable of automatically switching filter parameters and algorithms according to different operating states and stages, ensuring the accuracy and real-time performance of filtering results under various states and stages, and being able to automatically detect and handle anomalies in filtering results caused by changes in operating state or stage.

The system should be capable of recording and storing historical data and results of filter processing, and provide functions for querying and analyzing historical data to facilitate system maintenance and optimization.

requirement: The system should be able to calculate the rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy based on the current flight status and target status.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the calculation of rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy is coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions to avoid calculation errors or inconsistencies.

The system should be capable of detecting and processing calculations of the rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy under different operating conditions, ensuring the correctness of function implementation when two or more redundancies are in different states.

The system should be capable of adjusting and optimizing the calculation of rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy according to different working phases and states, ensuring the correctness and effectiveness of functional processing.

The system should be capable of real-time monitoring and verification of the calculated results for rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy, analyzing the correctness and safety of functional processing under conditions where the control solution results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values.

The system should be able to trigger a warning mechanism and take corresponding corrective actions in case of anomalies or errors occurring during the calculation of rudder angles δz, δx, and δy, ensuring the safety and stability of the system.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the functionality of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2, including parameter setting and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: When implementing the lifting acceleration notch filter 2 function in the software system, parameter setting and filtering processing sequence shall be coordinated with hardware, and control conditions shall be complete and consistent.

The software system shall perform real-time checks on the control solution results of the lifting and lowering acceleration notch filter 2, and analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum and minimum value" of the control solution results.

The software system should set timeout detection for critical control or actions of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2, to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, and to trigger a warning mechanism.

The software system should adjust the control solution process of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2 function according to different states and working phases, and check the function inputs to analyze the correctness of function handling in cases such as 'working phase not considered' and 'working state not considered'.

The software system shall perform real-time checks on the execution conditions of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2 function, analyze the correctness of function handling under situations such as "condition not met" and "condition met again" during function execution, and trigger corresponding processing mechanisms.

The software system shall ensure that the lifting acceleration notch filter function can exit normally under abnormal conditions and return to its initial state, preventing the system from entering an indeterminate state.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function for the aileron channel, including parameter setting and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: When implementing the notch filter function for the aileron channel in the software system, it is necessary to ensure the correctness of parameter settings and filtering processing, including validity checks of filter parameters and verification of filtering results.

The software system should coordinate with the hardware to ensure consistency in control sequence and timing, completeness and consistency of control conditions, and timely response and adjustment when hardware status changes.

The software system should be capable of making corresponding judgments and handling situations when abnormal external factors occur (such as high sea conditions, severe weather conditions, etc.), including automatically switching to a safety mode, issuing warning signals, or taking other necessary measures.

The software system shall check the control solution results of the notch filter, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum and minimum values", and be able to take corresponding measures based on the results.

The software system shall check the execution conditions of the notch filter, analyze the correctness of function handling under conditions such as 'not satisfied' and 'satisfied again' during function execution, and adjust the function execution according to changes in conditions.

The software system should have a timeout detection mechanism for critical controls or actions to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, including measures such as issuing timeout warnings, automatic retries, or switching to a backup mode.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function for the rudder channel, including parameter setting and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: When implementing the notch filter function for the rudder channel in the software system, it is necessary to ensure the correctness of parameter settings and filtering processing, including reasonable configuration and real-time updating of parameters such as the filter's cutoff frequency and gain.

The system should perform real-time monitoring and inspection of the filtering process results, ensuring the filtered signal remains within the expected range and accurately reflects the rudder's status; otherwise, it should trigger a warning mechanism.

When the software system performs filtering processing, it should take into account changes in the hardware status, including handling during hardware failures or abnormal conditions, to ensure system stability and reliability.

The system should perform real-time evaluation of the filter's performance, including optimization of parameters such as filter order and type, to ensure the filter can effectively remove interference signals and improve the system's accuracy and reliability.

The software system should be able to adjust the filter parameters according to actual conditions under different states and operational phases, ensuring the filter can adapt to varying operating conditions and improving the system's flexibility and reliability.

The system should handle abnormal situations in the filtering process, including cases where the filtering results exceed the expected range and filter parameters become invalid, to ensure the stability and reliability of the system.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the Tustin bilinear transformation discretization to generate the discrete notch filter formula.
safety_requirements: When the software system performs discretization using the Tustin bilinear transformation, it should check data bits in the interface data that have discrete value ranges, ensure correct output when data values jump between consecutive cycles, and properly handle abnormal values.

The software system shall check the parameter change rate to ensure it is within a reasonable range (upper and lower slope limits) and have a clear handling strategy for data exceeding the slope limit, in order to prevent system instability.

The software system should check the transition conditions between every two states in the state space, analyze the correctness of state transitions under conditions such as "not set, always satisfied, never satisfied," and ensure the reliability of system state transitions.

The software system shall check data bits in interface data that have discrete value domains, analyze the correctness of outputs when data bit values are 'undefined abnormal values outside the valid range', and properly handle abnormal values to prevent system failures.
The software system shall ensure that its control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions to prevent system instability or failure.

When the software system performs discretization using the Tustin bilinear transformation, it should ensure the correctness of the discretized notch filter formula and properly handle the boundary conditions of the filter to prevent system instability or failure.

requirement: The flaps can be extended or retracted according to the needs of different flight phases or remote control, and have three deflection positions: 0°, 15°, and 40°.
safety_requirements: The system should be able to correctly extend or retract the flaps according to the requirements of different flight phases or remote control, ensure accurate setting of flap deflection positions (0°, 15°, and 40°), and perform real-time monitoring during the setting process, immediately triggering a warning mechanism upon detecting any abnormal conditions.

The system shall be capable of detecting and processing functional implementation under different operating conditions when extending or retracting the flaps, ensuring that functions can still be correctly executed in situations such as "two or more redundancies being in different states", and enabling corresponding control calculations according to the actual operational phase and status.

The system should be capable of real-time monitoring and checking the control resolution process of the flaps, analyzing the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "ignoring operational phases or statuses," and adjusting and optimizing based on the inspection results to ensure functional correctness and reliability.

The system should be capable of performing real-time comparison and verification of identical input data values received through different redundancy channels, analyzing the correctness of functional implementation when inconsistencies occur between two or more redundant data values, and correcting data and adjusting functions based on the comparison results.

The system should be capable of real-time monitoring and checking output data with different redundancy levels, analyzing the correctness of function implementation under conditions of "single redundancy failure, multiple redundancies failure", and performing fault diagnosis and maintenance based on the inspection results to ensure system reliability and safety.

requirement: The system should be able to automatically adjust the flap deflection position based on the information provided by the flight phase identification module.
safety_requirements: When adjusting the flap deflection position, the system should check whether the control conditions are complete and consistent, ensuring that they match the information provided by the flight phase identification module.

The system should monitor in real-time the adjustment of the flap deflection position, set up a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, and trigger a warning mechanism.

The system should check the control calculation results of the flap deflection position, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, to ensure the accuracy of the flap deflection position.

The system should automatically identify the current operating phase based on information provided by the flight phase identification module, and adjust the flap deflection position according to different operating phases to ensure the correctness of function processing.

The system should check the flap deflection angle positions under different operating conditions, analyze the correctness of functional implementation in two or more operating conditions, and ensure the accuracy and consistency of flap deflection angle positions.

requirement: The system should support manual adjustment of the flap deflection position via remote control.
safety_requirements: When the system remotely controls manual adjustment of the flap deflection position, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and that control conditions are complete and consistent.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing the system from entering an unpredictable state.

After the system performs hardware control, it should monitor and determine whether the hardware status matches the control requirements, ensuring that the flap's deflection position is correctly adjusted.
The system should output the control status at times that meet the scenario requirements, avoiding system errors or instability caused by inappropriate timing.

The system should check the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control solution results are "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", etc., to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should record and retain logs of all remote control operations, including control commands, execution results, and any error messages, to facilitate post-event analysis and troubleshooting.

requirement: The system should be capable of receiving and processing data provided by the flight phase identification module to determine the current flight phase.
safety_requirements: The system should be capable of monitoring in real-time the transmission and reception cycles of data provided by the flight phase recognition module, ensuring both cycles are matched to avoid data processing errors caused by cycle mismatches.

After the system starts executing a task, it should be able to detect when input data is received again and its execution conditions are met once more, ensuring the correctness of function processing and making corresponding adjustments based on the new data.

The system should be able to detect the situation of 'continuously not receiving new data', and ensure the correctness of the output in such cases, preventing erroneous judgments caused by missing data.

The system should be capable of verifying the communication protocol of interface data frames to ensure the correctness of critical information such as "data frame identifier," thereby preventing data processing anomalies caused by protocol errors.

The system should be capable of detecting "data frame loss" situations and ensure the correctness of outputs through appropriate error correction or retransmission mechanisms to maintain data integrity and accuracy.

requirement: The system should be able to select the appropriate flap deflection position based on the current flight phase.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the completeness and consistency of control conditions when selecting flap deflection positions, and the control sequence and timing should be coordinated with the hardware.
The system should output the control status at the appropriate time that meets the scenario requirements, avoiding safety risks caused by premature or delayed outputs.

The system should limit the rate of change of the flap deflection position, set reasonable upper and lower slope limits, and define a handling strategy for over-slope data to ensure that changes in flap deflection position remain within safe limits.

The system should be capable of detecting and handling different redundancy levels in various operational states, ensuring correct selection of flap deflection positions in such cases and preventing safety hazards.

The system should be capable of real-time monitoring of changes in the flight phase, and automatically adjust the flap deflection position according to these changes, ensuring that the flap deflection position matches the current flight phase and meets safety requirements.

requirement: The system should be capable of recording and displaying the current flap deflection angle position.
safety_requirements: The system should be able to record and display the current flap deflection angle position in real time, and ensure the accuracy and consistency of the recorded data.
The system shall check the completeness and sequential consistency of control conditions when recording and displaying flap deflection position to ensure coordination with hardware.

The system should be able to handle situations where different redundancies are in various operating states, ensuring the correctness of function implementation, whether a single redundancy or multiple redundancies are in different states simultaneously.
The system should maintain the real-time performance and accuracy of critical status records after a fault or recovery, ensuring that the recorded data remains reliable.
The system should be able to detect and handle output data faults in one or multiple redundancies, ensuring the correctness of function implementation and the safety of the system.

requirement: The system needs to calculate the values of δz(k), δx(k), and δy(k) through bilinear transformation based on the given pitch angle Jg, roll angle Yg, and rudder control amount yg.
safety_requirements: When the system performs calculations using the bilinear transform method, it should check the variation rates of the pitch angle Jg, roll angle Yg, and rudder control amount yg to ensure they are within reasonable ranges, and apply clear handling strategies for data exceeding these ranges.

The system shall ensure that the sequence and timing of control are coordinated with the hardware, control conditions are complete and consistent, to guarantee the accuracy and validity of the calculated δz(k), δx(k), and δy(k) values.

The system should perform real-time checks on the calculated δz(k), δx(k), and δy(k) values, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum/minimum value," and ensure that a warning mechanism is triggered in case of abnormalities.

The system should check data bits in the interface data with discrete value ranges, analyze situations where data values jump between consecutive cycles, and ensure the correctness and consistency of outputs.

The system should be differentiated according to different states and working phases to ensure the correctness and validity of functional inputs, avoiding errors caused by "not considering the working phase" or "not considering the working state".

The system should perform a discretization check on the calculated δz(k), δx(k), and δy(k) values to ensure they meet predefined discretization conditions, and take corrective actions if these conditions are not satisfied.

requirement: During the aircraft's ground waiting phase, the flaps are set to 0°.
safety_requirements: During the aircraft's ground waiting phase, when the flaps are set to 0°, the system should check whether the flap angle setting is correct to ensure it complies with the current flight condition.
The system should validate the flap angle settings, provide alerts for abnormal parameters or ignore them, to prevent incorrect flap configurations from causing aircraft safety issues.

When personnel operate the flaps, the system should determine whether the operation is reasonable. If the command does not match the current scenario or status, the system should not respond, ensuring aircraft safety.

The system should check the data processing procedure for flap angle, analyze whether there is a division by zero in the data processing, and prevent system crash or aircraft safety issues caused by division by zero errors.

When the operating state is transferred, the system should check the values of the functional interface data, analyze the correctness of the output in cases such as "value has not changed," and ensure that the flap angle setting is correct and matches the current flight status.

requirement: When the aircraft begins takeoff, from the start of the ground roll phase, the flaps are deflected to 15°.
safety_requirements: During aircraft takeoff, the flaps are deflected to 15°, the system should ensure accurate control of flap position and be capable of real-time monitoring of flap position to prevent exceeding the allowed error range.
The system should have a power failure recovery or run-away reset mechanism, which allows the system to quickly return to normal operation and ensure aircraft safety when such events occur.

The parameters in the system should have reasonable rates of change, with upper and lower slope limits set, and a clear strategy for handling out-of-slope data should be established to prevent safety issues caused by excessively rapid parameter changes.

The system should perform real-time checks on the communication status of interface data frames, analyze the correctness of outputs in cases such as "data frame loss," and take corresponding measures to ensure data integrity and accuracy.

The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to prevent safety issues caused by control logic errors.

The system should check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation in cases such as "two or more redundancies are in different states," and ensure that the system can still maintain a safe state under these circumstances.

requirement: Start timing when reaching climb segment 1; if the landing gear is retracted within 1 minute, delay for 5 seconds after retraction and then retract flaps to 0°.
safety_requirements: When flying to the first climb segment, the system should start timing and check the moment when the landing gear is retracted. It must ensure that after retracting the landing gear within 1 minute, the flaps are retracted to 0° with a 5-second delay. If the retraction exceeds 1 minute, an exception handling procedure shall be triggered.

The system should monitor the moment when the landing gear is retracted and check the flap position after a 5-second delay, ensuring that the flaps are correctly retracted to 0°. If the flaps are not retracted or are incorrectly positioned, the warning mechanism should be triggered.

The system should check the sequence of landing gear retraction and flap deployment to ensure they are executed in accordance with specified timing. If the timing is inconsistent, an exception handling process should be triggered.

The system should check the timing of landing gear retraction, analyze the correctness of flap deployment and retraction when input values are "too early stop, too late stop", etc., and trigger a warning mechanism if any abnormality occurs.

The system should check the timing of flap deployment and retraction, analyze input values during situations such as "early input" or "late input," verify the correctness of flap operation under these conditions, and trigger a warning mechanism if any anomalies occur.

requirement: If the landing gear has not been retracted after 1 minute, directly retract the flaps to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the time required for the landing gear retraction process. If the retraction is not completed within 1 minute, the flaps should automatically retract to 0°, and the abnormal event should be recorded.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism, which triggers a warning mechanism and takes corresponding actions when the landing gear retraction process exceeds the preset time (e.g., 1 minute).

The system shall handle situations where the landing gear fails to retract, and when the redundancy switching condition is met but the switch fails, the system shall record the error and trigger a warning mechanism.

The system should monitor the communication status of interface data frames, and when new data is not received continuously, the system should take appropriate measures, such as retransmitting requests or triggering an alarm mechanism.

The system should implement timeout detection for critical controls or actions to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period. For example, if the landing gear retraction exceeds the allowed time, the system should trigger a warning mechanism and take appropriate measures.

requirement: When the aircraft is flying on the fourth leg of the five-leg traffic pattern, if the distance to the destination point is less than 1500m, deploy flaps to 15°.
safety_requirements: When the aircraft flies to the fourth leg of the five-leg approach pattern, if the distance to the destination point is less than 1500 meters, the flaps should automatically extend to 15°, and real-time monitoring should be conducted to ensure safe landing of the aircraft.

When the aircraft approaches to a distance less than 1500m, the system should perform sensor data validation to check for sensor faults or data exceeding the acquisition range, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system shall be capable of handling single or multiple redundancy failures and maintaining the aircraft's stability and safety under such circumstances, ensuring normal deployment and retraction of the flaps.

The system should have reasonable limits on the rate of parameter changes, and when these limits are exceeded, appropriate handling strategies should be implemented to ensure the safety and stability of the aircraft, preventing abnormal flap oscillations.

requirement: When flying to the fifth side, deploy flaps to 40° when the distance from the intended landing point is less than Hw / tgλ + 1020 m and greater than Hw / tgλ + 20 m.
safety_requirements: When the system flies to the fifth side, it should monitor the distance to the predetermined landing point. When the distance is less than Hw / tgλ + 1020m and greater than Hw / tgλ + 20m, the flaps should automatically extend to 40°, and ensure the timing of flap extension meets the scenario requirements.

The system should check whether the sensor's measurement range is clearly defined, report a sensor fault when the measured value exceeds the range, and ensure the accuracy and reliability of the sensor data.
The system should monitor the duration of the output state to ensure it meets the constraint requirements and trigger a warning mechanism when the duration exceeds the specified time.

The system should check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation when two or more redundancies are in different states, and ensure the stability and safety of the system under various operating conditions.

The system should monitor the flap deployment status in real time, and when the flaps fail to deploy properly or the deployment angle is incorrect, it should trigger a fault alarm and emergency handling mechanism to ensure flight safety.

requirement: If the aircraft does not enter the glide slope window, the flaps are retracted to 15° (with corresponding changes in Vg) after the aircraft levels off again.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the aircraft's glide slope window status and ensure that the action of retracting the flaps to 15° after the aircraft levels off is correctly executed when the aircraft has not entered the glide slope window, and that the corresponding Vg change is accurate.

The system should monitor the communication status of interface data frames. When no new data is received continuously, it should output the correct status information and trigger the corresponding handling mechanism.

The system should detect redundancy switch conditions, and when the conditions are met but the switch fails, the software should have a proper handling mechanism to ensure system stability and safety.

The system should monitor the communication status of interface data frames, and when data frame loss occurs, it should output the correct status information and trigger the corresponding handling mechanism to ensure system reliability.

The system should monitor the communication status of interface data frames, and when communication is interrupted, it should output the correct status information and trigger the corresponding handling mechanism to ensure system reliability.

The system should have a clear fault recovery mechanism to ensure rapid return to normal operation in case of a fault, and the recovery mechanism should be reasonable and effective, ensuring the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: If the aircraft enters the glide window, the flaps will remain at 40° until landing is completed.
safety_requirements: When the aircraft enters the glide slope window, the system shall ensure that the flaps remain at 40° until full landing is achieved, regardless of software power interruption and restart.

After a software power failure and restart, the system should automatically check and restore the flap status to ensure it remains at 40° and can correctly respond to changes in the aircraft's condition.

The system should be able to detect the conditions for an aircraft entering the glide slope window and automatically set the flaps to 40° when the conditions are met, while ensuring proper exit from this state when the conditions are not satisfied.

The system should be able to correctly control the flap angle during different operating phases and conditions, especially ensuring that the flaps remain at 40° when the aircraft enters the glide window, in order to ensure flight safety.

In the event of an excessively long redundancy switch-over time, the system should be capable of properly handling the situation and ensuring that the flap angle setting remains unaffected at 40° to prevent flight accidents.

requirement: During normal landing, the system starts extending flaps to 15° at point A and extends flaps to 40° at point B; during reverse landing, the system starts extending flaps to 15° at point C and extends flaps to 40° at point D.
safety_requirements: The system should begin extending the flaps to 15° at point A and extend them to 40° at point B during the landing phase, ensuring the correct sequence and control logic between the two points.
The system should begin deploying the flaps to 15° at point C and deploy them to 40° at point D during reverse landing, ensuring the correct timing sequence and control logic between the two points.

The system should check the functional control resolution process under different states and working phases to ensure the correctness of functional processing in cases such as "working phase not considered" or "working state not considered".

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of control operations are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and that safety risks resulting from improper control are avoided.

The system should check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation in cases such as "two or more redundancies are in different states," and ensure that the system can operate normally under all working conditions.

requirement: In remote control mode, when the system receives the "Flap Position 0" command from the remote controller, it sends a flap 0° control signal; when receiving the "Flap Position 1" command, it sends a flap 15° control signal; and when receiving the "Flap Position 2" command, it sends a flap 40° control signal.
safety_requirements: When the system is in remote control mode, it should check received remote control commands to ensure that flap position control is executed only under correct operating conditions and phases, and verify the validity and integrity of the control commands.

The system shall perform real-time monitoring and validation of the flap position control signals to ensure that the output control signals (e.g., 0°, 15°, 40°) are accurate, conform to the intended control logic, and can properly handle boundary values and abnormal values.

The system shall ensure the correctness of control sequence and timing when performing flap position control, and all necessary control conditions shall be met and maintained consistently to avoid control conflicts or uncertainties.

After a power failure and subsequent restart, the system should be able to correctly recover its previous state and perform a self-check on the restarted state to ensure accuracy and consistency of the state, in order to prevent safety hazards caused by incorrect recovery.

The system should correctly handle flap position control under different operating conditions, especially when multiple conditions exist simultaneously, ensuring correct implementation of functions and consistency of states, as well as properly managing transitions and boundary conditions between states.

The system should have corresponding fault-tolerant and early-warning mechanisms during flap position control, capable of promptly detecting and alarming any anomalies or control failures to ensure flight safety.

requirement: The system needs to set different reference attitude angles according to different flight phases during the takeoff and departure segment, specifically as follows: longitudinal Jg = 4.5°, lateral yg = 0°.
safety_requirements: During the takeoff and departure phase, the system should set different reference attitude angles according to different flight phases, ensuring that the longitudinal Jg and lateral yg values are correctly set to 4.5° and 0°, respectively, and perform attitude control based on these settings.
The system should check the timing of output control status to ensure it meets scenario requirements, avoiding premature or delayed output of control signals that may affect flight safety.

The system should be able to identify and handle state transitions across different flight phases, ensuring correctness and consistency of function implementation when two or more redundancies are in different states.

The system should check functional inputs and analyze the correctness of functional processing without considering operational phases or states, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the control solution process.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of control are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions, to avoid flight safety risks caused by improper control.

requirement: The retraction control of the landing gear is initiated by a landing gear retraction signal and verified through a retracted lock signal. The extension control of the landing gear is initiated by a landing gear extension signal and verified through an extended lock signal. If extension fails, an emergency extension signal can be used to activate the emergency pump.
safety_requirements: During landing gear retraction control, the system should check the landing gear retraction signal and the uplock signal to ensure that control signals are issued under the correct operating conditions and phases, and to trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

When controlling the landing gear deployment, the system should check the landing gear down signal and the downlock signal to ensure that control signals are issued under the correct operating conditions and phase, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should monitor the retraction lock and extension lock signals in real time to ensure that the landing gear's retracted and extended statuses match the expected statuses, and trigger a warning mechanism when a status mismatch occurs.

The system shall check the emergency lowering signal to ensure that the emergency pump is correctly triggered if the lowering operation fails, and monitor the status of the emergency pump during its operation to ensure the safety of the landing gear.

After a software power failure and restart, the system should check the status of the landing gear to ensure correct status recovery, and trigger a warning mechanism if the status recovery is incorrect.

The system should check the control calculation process, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control calculation results are "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.

The system should monitor the control solution process, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases such as timeout (failure to return results within the specified time), and trigger a warning mechanism in case of timeout.

requirement: The landing gear can be controlled for extension and retraction in autonomous control, manual correction, and remote control modes. During autonomous control or manual correction, the flight control system automatically extends or retracts the landing gear based on the aircraft's position, motion, and other information. In remote control mode, the ground control station can issue commands at any time to extend or retract the landing gear.
safety_requirements: When the system is in autonomous control, manual correction, or remote control mode, it should correctly implement landing gear retraction and extension control, ensure correct processing of aircraft position, motion and other information, and trigger a warning mechanism in abnormal situations.

The system should be able to correctly perform function input checks and control calculations under different states and operational phases, ensuring the correctness of function handling in cases such as "unconsidered operational phases" and "unconsidered operational states".

After power recovery or the activation of the runaway reset mechanism, the system should be able to return to normal operating conditions, ensuring the landing gear extension and retraction control functions operate normally.

The system should correctly handle control resolution results, including "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", to ensure the correctness of landing gear extension and retraction control.

The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the correctness of landing gear extension and retraction control.
The system should correctly handle timeout situations during the control solution process, ensuring results are returned within the specified time, otherwise triggering a warning mechanism.

When the system is in remote control mode, it should correctly process commands from the ground control station, ensure the correctness of landing gear deployment and retraction control, and trigger a warning mechanism in abnormal situations.

The system should be capable of recording and storing the landing gear extension/retraction control history, including control resolution results and abnormal conditions, to facilitate post-event analysis and maintenance.

requirement: When the aircraft takes off and reaches the first climb phase with the landing gear in the down position, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to high level, and simultaneously send left and right brake signals (with brake pressure at 50% FS).
safety_requirements: The system shall correctly set the landing gear retraction signal to high level and issue left and right brake signals (brake pressure at 50% FS) when the aircraft takes off, reaches climb phase 1, and the landing gear is in the deployed position, ensuring that this operation is not affected by power loss recovery or run-away reset mechanisms.

The system should be able to distinguish between different operational phases and states, and correctly control the landing gear retraction and braking functions based on the current state, preventing functional handling errors caused by failure to account for the operational phase or state.

The system should be capable of detecting the status of external devices (such as sensors, NVM, databases, other systems, etc.), and ensure the correctness of landing gear retraction and braking functions when these devices are in a power-off or initialization state.

The system should ensure that the timing of output control status meets scenario requirements, for example, correctly outputting gear retraction and brake signals when the aircraft takes off, reaches climb phase 1, and the landing gear is in the down position.

After a power failure and subsequent restart of the software, the system shall be able to correctly recover to its normal operating state and ensure the proper execution of the landing gear retraction and braking functions, preventing safety issues caused by incomplete or incorrect state recovery after restart.

requirement: After 1s, the system should check the landing gear retraction lock signal. If the retraction lock signal is at low level, continue to check the landing gear extension/retraction status.
safety_requirements: When the system checks the retraction lock signal, it should ensure the reliability and real-time nature of the signal to prevent system failures caused by signal errors or delays.

The system shall immediately check the landing gear retraction and extension status upon receiving a low-level signal for retracting and locking, and ensure the accuracy and consistency of the status.

When checking the landing gear extension and retraction status, the system should take into account different operational phases and conditions to ensure the correctness and reliability of functional processing.

The system should perform real-time checks and verification of the results during control calculations to ensure their accuracy and validity, especially in handling boundary values and extreme maximum or minimum values.

The system should be able to quickly recover to a normal operating state upon power failure restart or runaway reset, and ensure the correctness and consistency of the state, preventing system failures caused by recovery errors.
The system should have comprehensive logging and fault diagnosis functions to facilitate post-event analysis and troubleshooting, ensuring the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the down position, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to low level, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction fault flag.
safety_requirements: When the system is in the landing gear down state, it should ensure that the landing gear retraction signal is set to low level, the left and right brake signals are set to 0, and the landing gear retraction fault flag is correctly set, to prevent safety risks caused by erroneous operations.

After a power failure and subsequent restart of the software, the system should be able to correctly recover the landing gear-related status, ensure the accuracy of status execution, and prevent safety issues caused by incomplete or incorrect status recovery.

The system should check the control solution results to ensure the correctness of functional processing under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, preventing safety risks caused by incorrect control solution results.

The system's fault detection should include a false alarm prevention mechanism to ensure that false alarm handling does not affect the real-time requirements of alarm processing, preventing safety issues caused by false alarms.

The system should correctly perform functional control calculations based on different states and operational phases, preventing functional processing errors caused by neglecting operational phases or states, ensuring safety.

After power recovery or the activation of the runaway reset mechanism, the system should be able to return to normal operating conditions, ensuring proper functioning of landing gear-related systems and preventing safety risks.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the retracted position, the system shall set the landing gear retraction signal to low level and set both left and right brake signals to 0.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the control solution results under the landing gear retracted condition, ensuring that the landing gear retract signal and left/right brake signals are correctly set, in accordance with expected 'normal values', 'abnormal values', 'boundary values', and 'maximum/minimum values' scenarios.

When a software power failure and restart occur during the system state execution, the system should be able to correctly recover the landing gear retracted state, avoiding situations of "state not recovered" or "incorrect recovery", ensuring correct settings for the landing gear signal and left/right brake signals.

The system should check the control resolution process under the landing gear retracted condition based on the current operational phase and status, to ensure that scenarios of 'unconsidered operational phase' and 'unconsidered operational status' do not lead to functional processing errors.

The system shall coordinate with the hardware to ensure correct control sequence and timing under landing gear retracted conditions, with complete and consistent control criteria, avoiding system errors caused by unmet hardware status.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, such as when the landing gear retraction signal remains unasserted at low level for too long, ensuring the system can properly handle such conditions and prevent safety risks.

requirement: If the retraction lock signal is high, the system should periodically check the retraction lock signal.
safety_requirements: The system should be equipped with a timeout determination for the retraction lock signal, ensuring that the system can respond promptly and take appropriate measures when the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period.

The system should check the control resolution results of the retract lock signal, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum and minimum values," to ensure the system's stability and reliability.
The system should have a detection mechanism for output circuits, enabling loop status monitoring without affecting normal output, to ensure the reliability and effectiveness of the output circuit.

The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the stability and reliability of the system.
The system should perform real-time monitoring and recording of periodic inspection results for the retracted lock signal, ensuring that any anomalies can be detected and addressed promptly.

requirement: If the uplock signal becomes low within 1 minute, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to low, set both left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear status to retracted.
safety_requirements: After the system's retract lock signal becomes low, it should set the retract landing gear signal to low and set both left and right brake signals to 0 within 1 minute, and update the landing gear status to retracted, ensuring correctness and timing of the state transition.

After a software power failure and restart, the system should be able to correctly recover the landing gear status, including retracting the landing gear signal, left and right brake signals, and landing gear status, ensuring the correctness and integrity of the status recovery.

The system shall check the control resolution results of the landing gear retraction signal, left and right brake signals, and landing gear status, analyze the correctness of functional processing under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the control resolution results.

After a power failure and subsequent restart of the system software, it should be able to re-establish interface data communication. The correctness of outputs under circumstances such as interface data communication interruption, reconnection, and failure to recover shall be analyzed, ensuring the reliability and real-time performance of interface data communication.

The system should set a timeout judgment for the process of landing gear status transition after the retract lock signal turns to low level, to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for a long time, ensuring system safety and reliability.

After power recovery or the activation of the runaway reset mechanism, the system shall be able to return to normal operating conditions, including landing gear status, landing gear retraction signal, left and right brake signals, etc., to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: If the retraction lock signal remains high after 1 minute, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to low, set both left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction fault flag.
safety_requirements: The system shall correctly set the landing gear retraction signal to low level and the left/right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction fault flag when the retraction lock signal remains high for more than 1 minute, ensuring correct state transition and safety.

After a software power failure and restart, the system should be able to correctly recover its previous state, especially the state related to the retractable lock signal, to avoid safety risks caused by state loss or incorrect recovery.
