The system should have a false alarm prevention mechanism to ensure that no false fault alarms are generated when the retracted lock signal remains high, while also meeting real-time alarm handling requirements to avoid unnecessary interference or operations caused by false alarms.

The system should perform timeout checks during the execution of landing gear retraction and braking operations, so that corresponding measures can be taken in case the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing safety hazards.

The system should monitor and verify in real time the processing results of the retract lock signal, ensuring that any abnormal conditions (such as signal loss, errors, etc.) can be promptly detected and addressed to prevent the system from entering an unsafe state.

requirement: When the aircraft returns to the third leg of the five-leg traffic pattern and the distance to the destination is less than 5000m, the system shall set both left and right brakes to 100% and set the landing gear deployment signal to high level.
safety_requirements: The system shall automatically set the left and right brakes to 100% and set the landing gear deployment signal to high level when the aircraft returns to the third leg of the traffic pattern and the distance to the destination is less than 5000m, ensuring safe landing of the aircraft.

The system should have automatic detection and correction capabilities. When the left or right brake or landing gear deployment signals are set incorrectly, the system should be able to automatically correct the error and issue a warning signal.

After power recovery or activation of the runaway reset mechanism, the system shall be able to return to normal operation and automatically verify whether the left and right brake and landing gear deployment signals are correctly configured.
The system should be capable of detecting and handling different interface data anomalies, including single redundancy failure, total redundancy failure, etc., to ensure aircraft safety landing.

The system should be able to correctly control the calculation of left and right brake signals and landing gear deployment signals under different states and operating phases, ensuring safe aircraft landing.

The system shall have real-time monitoring capabilities to monitor the aircraft's status and the settings of the left and right brakes and landing gear deployment signals. Upon detecting any abnormal conditions, the system shall automatically issue warning signals and take appropriate actions.

requirement: The system needs to calculate the value of yg based on the lateral offset Dz, lateral offset velocity Dz, and Δy using the formula.
safety_requirements: When calculating the yg value, the system should check whether the lateral offset Dz, lateral offset speed Dz, and the rate of change of Δy are within reasonable ranges, and have a clear handling strategy for data exceeding these ranges.

The system shall ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent to avoid calculation errors or system instability when calculating the yg value.

The system should perform real-time checks on the calculated yg value, analyze whether it is a normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, or extreme maximum/minimum value, ensure the correctness of functional processing, and trigger the alarm mechanism in case of abnormalities.

When calculating the yg value, the system should check whether the data bit value precision of the interface data is greater than or equal to the required precision, and ensure output correctness in such cases.

When calculating the yg value, the system should check whether the data bit value accuracy of the interface data is less than the required precision, and have corresponding measures to ensure the correctness of the output or trigger a warning mechanism.
The system shall log the calculation process of the YG value and be capable of tracing key data and parameters during the calculation, facilitating fault diagnosis and safety audit.

requirement: The system should check the unlock signal after 1s.
safety_requirements: The system should check the unlock signal after 1 second and set a timeout judgment to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring system reliability and safety.
The system's control of the unlock signal should be coordinated with the hardware to ensure complete and consistent control conditions, avoiding safety hazards caused by timing issues.
After power recovery or the activation of the runaway reset mechanism, the system should be able to return to normal operation and perform a self-check to ensure safety and reliability.

After a software power failure and restart during system state execution, a state check should be conducted to analyze the correctness of state execution in cases such as "state not restored, error recovery" after the restart, and measures should be taken to recover to a normal state.

The system should have a clear fault recovery mechanism. The recovery mechanism should be reasonable and effectively handle faults caused by failed signal checks during unlocking, ensuring the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: If the landing gear unlock signal is low, indicating a fault in the landing gear extension circuit, then set the emergency landing gear extension signal to high. After one minute, set both the landing gear extension and emergency landing gear extension signals to low (in this case, the landing gear unlock signal cannot be checked), and set the left and right brakes to their respective preset values, and set the landing gear extension fault flag to active.
safety_requirements: After a software power failure and restart, the system should check whether the current status has returned to normal. If the status is not restored or the error recovery fails, an alarm mechanism should be triggered and status repair initiated.

The system shall check whether the interface data communication is interrupted or reconnected when the software experiences a power failure and restarts. If the communication cannot be restored, an early warning mechanism should be triggered to perform data recovery.

The system should be equipped with a false alarm prevention mechanism to avoid false fault alarms, and the false alarm prevention process should meet the real-time requirements of alarm handling, ensuring the reliability and safety of the system.

The system should perform real-time checks on the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control solution results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and if any anomalies are detected, it should trigger a safety warning mechanism and take appropriate action.

The system's fault detection logic should be reasonable, the detection method should not affect the normal operation of the equipment, and it should be able to accurately detect fault items, trigger the early warning mechanism, and handle them accordingly.

When the system experiences a landing gear extension circuit failure, it should ensure the correct setting and clearing of the emergency landing gear extension signal, and should check the preset amounts of left and right brakes as well as the validity of the landing gear extension fault flag, to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: If the gear down lock signal is high, periodically check the gear down lock signal: if the gear down lock signal becomes low within 1 minute, it indicates that the landing gear has been lowered; set the gear down signal to low, set the landing gear status to down, set the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset values, and set the landing gear down failure flag to invalid.
safety_requirements: When the system detects that the landing gear downlock signal is high, it should periodically check the status of the landing gear downlock signal. If the signal becomes low within 1 minute, the system shall set the landing gear deployment signal to low, indicate the landing gear status as down, set the left and right brakes to their respective preset values, and mark the landing gear deployment fault flag as invalid, ensuring the correctness and safety of the landing gear deployment process.

After a power failure and subsequent restart of the system software, the system should check the status after rebooting to ensure correct status recovery. If the status is not recovered or incorrectly recovered, an alarm mechanism should be triggered and fault information recorded.

After a power failure and subsequent restart of the system software, the interface data communication should be checked to ensure that the interface data communication reconnects properly. If the interface data communication is interrupted or cannot be restored, an alarm mechanism should be triggered and fault information recorded.

The system should check the control solution results for the lower lock signal, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values. If the control solution result is abnormal, the warning mechanism should be triggered and fault information recorded.

The system shall implement false alarm prevention measures for fault detection, and such measures shall meet the real-time requirements for alarm handling, ensuring the reliability and safety of the system.

The system should check the safety values of interface data, compare the safety values with the normal values of the interface data when no fault occurs, analyze the correctness of the output when the difference between the safety value and the normal value under non-fault conditions is excessively large, and if the difference is too large, trigger a warning mechanism and record the fault information.

requirement: If the gear down lock signal is high, periodically check the gear down lock signal: if the gear down lock signal remains high after 1 minute, it indicates a landing gear extension fault; then set the emergency landing gear extension signal to high and periodically check the gear down lock signal again after 1 second.
safety_requirements: When the system detects that the landing gear downlock signal is at a high level, it should periodically check this signal. If the signal remains high after 1 minute, it shall be determined as a landing gear extension fault, triggering the emergency landing gear extension signal, and continue to periodically check the landing gear downlock signal after 1 second.

After a power failure and subsequent restart of the system software, the system should check its status to ensure correct recovery. If the status is not restored or incorrectly restored, an alarm mechanism should be triggered, and fault information should be recorded.

After a power failure and subsequent restart of the system software, the system should check the interface data communication to ensure that the communication has been successfully reconnected. If the communication is interrupted or cannot be restored, an alarm mechanism should be triggered and fault information recorded.

The system should check the results of the landing gear control solution, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system's fault detection logic should be reasonable, shall not affect the normal operation of the equipment, and shall include a false alarm prevention mechanism to ensure real-time alarm handling requirements.

The system should monitor the fault detection results of the landing gear retraction in real time and immediately trigger a warning mechanism upon the occurrence of a fault, ensuring the safe operation of the equipment.

requirement: If the unlock signal remains high after 1 minute, it indicates failure of the emergency landing gear extension. Set both the landing gear extension and emergency landing gear extension signals to low, set the left and right brakes to their respective preset values, and set the landing gear extension fault flag to active.
safety_requirements: When the system detects that the lock signal remains high after 1 minute, it shall immediately set the landing gear extension and emergency landing gear extension signals to low, set the left and right brakes to their respective preset values, set the landing gear extension fault flag to active, and ensure correct state transitions during this process.

After a software power failure and restart, the system should perform a status check to ensure correct status recovery, avoid incorrect recovery or loss of status, and properly handle situations such as "status not recovered" or "incorrect recovery" that may occur after the restart.

The system should be equipped with a false alarm prevention mechanism to ensure the real-time performance and accuracy of fault detection, prevent the occurrence of false alarms, and meet the real-time requirements for alarm handling.

The system shall check interface data communication during software power failure and restart, ensuring the continuity and correctness of interface data communication, and analyze and handle output correctness under conditions such as "interruption, reconnection, and unrecoverable failure."

The system should check the control solution results to ensure correct functional processing under conditions such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values," and correctly handle any possible abnormal situations.
The system's fault detection should cover all possible fault items to ensure the sufficiency and effectiveness of fault detection, enabling timely identification and handling of potential faults.

requirement: If the lock-down signal goes low within 1 minute, it indicates that the emergency landing gear extension is successful. After a delay of 2 seconds, both the landing gear extension and emergency landing gear extension signals are set to low level, the landing gear status is set to extended, the left and right brakes are set to their respective preset values, and the landing gear extension fault flag is set to invalid.
safety_requirements: When the system detects a low-level lock signal within 1 minute, it should immediately check the landing gear emergency release status to ensure the correctness of the landing gear deployment operation. After 2 seconds, the related signal shall be set to low level, the landing gear status shall be updated to deployed, the left and right brakes shall be set to the preset value, and the landing gear deployment fault flag shall be set to invalid.

After a power failure and subsequent restart, the system should perform a status check to ensure correct state recovery, prevent safety hazards caused by incomplete or incorrect recovery, and inspect interface data communication to guarantee correct output in cases of communication interruption, reconnection, or unrecoverable conditions.

The system should check the control solution results of the functions, analyze the correctness of function processing under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the function processing.

The system should distinguish between different states and operational phases to ensure the correct control logic execution of functions, consider the impact of operational phases and states, and prevent safety hazards caused by neglecting operational phases or states.

The system should have a false alarm prevention mechanism to ensure the real-time performance and accuracy of fault detection, prevent safety hazards caused by false alarms, and ensure that false alarm prevention does not affect the real-time requirements for alarm handling.

requirement: During ground power-up, the system should initialize all signals and states to ensure the landing gear and braking system are in the correct initial state.
safety_requirements: During ground power-up, the system should check the status of external devices (such as sensors, NVM, databases, other systems, etc.) to ensure they are in the correct operating condition and verify the correctness of device outputs.

The system shall verify the initial status of the landing gear and brake systems, and ensure that the control sequence and timing of the systems are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions.

The system should have a power failure recovery or runaway reset mechanism, and after startup, it should be able to return to a normal operating state and verify the correctness of the executed state.
The system should perform a validity check on the device status when issuing hazardous control commands or actions, ensuring the safety of the control commands or actions.

The system shall perform status checks after a software power failure restart, analyze the correctness of status execution in cases such as "status not restored" and "error recovery" after restart, and take necessary corrective actions.
The system should ensure that all signals and statuses are properly initialized when powered on, to avoid safety risks caused by initialization errors.

requirement: Remote control commands for extending or retracting the landing gear can be issued in any control mode as required.
safety_requirements: When the system is retracting or extending the landing gear, it should check the current control mode and flight status to ensure the validity and safety of the remote control commands.

The system should monitor the hardware status during the landing gear extension and retraction process. If the hardware status does not meet control requirements for an extended period, the timeout detection mechanism should be triggered, and corresponding actions should be taken.

When the system issues commands to lower or retract the landing gear, it should perform equipment status checks to ensure the equipment is in a condition suitable for lowering or retracting the landing gear, and provide warnings for any potential hazardous situations.

The system should correctly resolve the control logic for extending and retracting the landing gear based on the current operating phase and status, to avoid safety issues caused by incorrect operating phases or statuses.

During the process of extending and retracting the landing gear, the system should ensure the correct timing, constraints, concurrency, and combination relationships among all functional control logics to prevent safety issues caused by logic errors.

requirement: Upon receiving the "Retract Landing Gear" remote command, if the flight phase is not ground waiting and the flight altitude is no less than 80m, proceed as per item 1) in 3.2.11.3 (excluding its conditions).
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the current flight phase is ground waiting. If so, it should not respond to the "retract landing gear" remote control command.
The system should check whether the current flight altitude is below 80 m. If so, it should not respond to the "retract landing gear" remote control command.

The system shall, upon receiving the "Retract landing gear" remote command, determine whether the current flight phase and flight altitude meet the response conditions. If the conditions are not met, no response shall be made.

The system shall follow the processing procedure specified in 3.2.11.3, item 1) when responding to the "retract landing gear" remote command, and ensure the correctness and safety of the processing result.

The system shall record and monitor the execution of all "retract landing gear" remote control commands, including command transmission, reception, and processing results, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: When receiving the remote control command "Lower Landing Gear", proceed according to item 2) of Section 3.2.11.3 (excluding its conditions).
safety_requirements: The system should evaluate the received 'landing gear deployment' remote command for reasonableness, ensuring the command is appropriate for the current scenario or state, and if not, it should not respond.
The system should specify and implement requirements for handling erroneous or invalid operations to prevent unintended actions.
The system should specify and implement response procedures for non-compliant operations to ensure all operations strictly follow the established processes.

When the system issues the 'landing gear deployment' control command, it should make a reasonableness judgment based on the equipment status to ensure the equipment is in a condition suitable for executing this command.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism. For critical controls or actions, such as "landing gear deployment," if the hardware status cannot meet the control requirements for an extended period, a warning or safety protection measure should be triggered.

requirement: The system should support adjusting the throttle valve opening by fine-tuning the throttle valve micro-adjustment amount during the takeoff phase, with the adjustment limit range being [-15%, 0%].
safety_requirements: The system should limit the rate of change of throttle fine-tuning within a reasonable range, ensure the upper and lower slope limits are properly set, and clearly handle data that exceeds this range.
The system should check whether the throttle valve value collected by the sensor is within the specified range (-15% to 0%) and report a sensor fault when the collected value exceeds this range.

The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of throttle valve quantities are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions, to avoid safety issues caused by improper control.

The system should check the control resolution results of the throttle valve opening, analyze the correctness of handling under different conditions (normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, etc.), to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should ensure that when the redundancy switching conditions are met, it does not cause abnormalities in the output values of the currently running functions, maintaining the system's stability and safety.
The system should monitor changes in the throttle position in real time and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies, ensuring flight safety.

requirement: Each of the two rear wheels of the aircraft has an independent braking system. The brakes use a PWM control scheme. The flight control computer sends a 2 kHz pulse width modulated signal to the braking system, where the brake torque is proportional to the duty cycle of the PWM signal. The duration of braking corresponds to the duration of the PWM signal.
safety_requirements: The aircraft brake system shall be able to correctly receive the 2kHz pulse width modulation signal sent by the flight control computer and calculate accurate brake torque based on the duty cycle.

The aircraft braking system should perform corresponding control calculations according to the current status and phase under different operating conditions and stages, ensuring the accuracy and safety of braking torque.

The control sequence and timing of the aircraft brake system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the normal operation of the brake system.

The aircraft brake system should have a timeout determination mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing brake system failure.
The aircraft braking system should be able to return to normal operating condition after power failure recovery or runway overrun reset mechanism activation, ensuring the safety of the aircraft.

The aircraft braking system should be capable of correctly handling the results of control calculations, including normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, to ensure the safety and reliability of the braking system.

The PWM control scheme for the aircraft braking system should ensure that the braking torque is proportional to the duty cycle of the pulse width modulation signal, thereby ensuring the accuracy and safety of the braking system.

requirement: If the full compression signal of the landing gear is valid and the airspeed is less than a certain speed threshold vk_may_brake, differential braking is used for course correction.
safety_requirements: The system should set up an overrun detection for the landing gear fully compressed signal being valid and the airspeed being less than a certain speed threshold vk_may_brake, to ensure appropriate measures are taken if the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period.

The system should check the control resolution results of differential braking for deviation correction, analyze the correctness of functional processing under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should control and compute the differential braking correction function according to different states and working phases, analyze the correctness of functional processing when the working phase or state is not considered, to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should check its status after a software power failure and restart, analyze the correctness of state execution in cases where the status fails to recover or recovers incorrectly after the restart, and ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of differential braking for error correction are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions, to guarantee the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: In autonomous control mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = -(Kz * Dz + Kz * Dz - K * Δy - Ky * wy)
safety_requirements: When the system is in autonomous control mode, the correctness of the differential brake control law calculation results should be checked to ensure their accuracy and effectiveness under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum and minimum extreme values.

The system should check the inputs of the differential brake control law based on the current operating status and phase, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the operating phase or status is not considered, and take appropriate corrective actions.

The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure the reliability and safety of differential brake control.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status cannot meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing the system from entering an unpredictable state.

The system should ensure the correctness of timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships among control logics of various functional points, to avoid safety hazards caused by logic errors.

The system should perform real-time monitoring and verification of the calculation results from the differential brake control law to ensure they meet the intended control objectives and safety requirements, and be capable of timely response and correction in case of anomalies.

requirement: In manual correction mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = -[Kz * (Dz - DzgSemi - DzsemiOld) + Kz * Dz - K * Δy - Ky * wy], where DzsemiOld is the lateral offset correction value during the flare segment.
safety_requirements: In manual correction mode, the system should check the input parameters of the differential brake control law to ensure that the operating phase and operating status are considered, and handle exceptions for cases where the operating phase or operating status are not considered.

The system should check the calculation results of the differential brake control law to ensure they are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values, and perform corresponding handling and warnings based on the different results.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of differential brake control are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and that exceptions are handled when these conditions are not met.

The system should check the temporal relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combination relationships between functional points to ensure these relationships are correct and handle exceptions for incorrect situations.

The system should check the differential brake control calculation process, analyze situations where the control calculation process exceeds the time limit, and handle and warn of exceptions in case of timeout.

The system should monitor the calculation results of the differential brake control law in real time, and trigger a warning mechanism to alert the driver or system for intervention when the results exceed predetermined thresholds or anomalies occur.

requirement: In the in-band loop remote control (attitude control) mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = K * (-yg) + Ky * wy
safety_requirements: When the system is in the attitude remote control (attitude control) mode, the input parameters of the differential brake control law should be checked to ensure that the values of K, -yg, Ky, and wy are reasonable and within the expected range, avoiding the impact of abnormal values on the control results.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the calculation results from the differential braking control law, checking whether the output δb value is within the expected range. If an abnormal value occurs, the warning mechanism should be triggered and necessary corrective actions taken.

The system should adjust the parameters of the differential braking control law according to actual conditions during different operational phases and states, ensuring accuracy and consistency of the control results, and avoiding control errors caused by ignoring operational phases or states.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to take appropriate actions, such as issuing warning signals or switching to backup control mode, when hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring system safety and reliability.

The system should ensure the correct timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships among control logics of all functional points, to avoid system failures or safety hazards caused by logic conflicts or timing errors.

requirement: In the non-internal-loop remote control (control surface remote control) mode, the specific formula for the differential braking control law is not provided, but the corresponding control logic needs to be implemented.
safety_requirements: In the system's non-internal-loop remote control (control surface remote control) mode, the logic of the differential braking control law must be correct and consistent with the hardware coordination, ensuring complete and coherent control conditions.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring system stability and safety.

The system shall check functional inputs, analyze the correctness of functional processing under different operational phases and states, and ensure the accuracy and consistency of the control solution process.
The system should ensure that the timing of output control status meets the scenario requirements to avoid safety risks caused by improper output timing.
The system should have an output loop detection mechanism that performs loop status checks without affecting normal output, ensuring system reliability and safety.

The system should be able to detect and handle abnormal situations caused by hardware conditions failing to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring the system's stability and safety.

requirement: During the ground waiting phase, the differential brake control law under autonomous and manual correction modes is: δb = 0.
safety_requirements: During the ground waiting phase, the system shall check the differential brake control laws under autonomous and manual correction modes to ensure δb = 0, and trigger a timeout judgment mechanism if the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period.

The system should analyze the functional control resolution process of the differential braking control laws under autonomous and manual correction modes in different states and operation phases, ensure correct functional inputs, and handle exceptions when operation phases or states are not considered.

The system should verify the results of differential brake control laws under autonomous and manual correction modes to ensure that the results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.

The system shall ensure that the control sequence and timing of differential braking control laws under autonomous and manual correction modes are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and that exception handling is performed when control conditions are not met.

The system shall check the status entry conditions for differential braking control laws under autonomous and manual correction modes, ensuring that entry conditions are met, not met, or met again during state execution, and perform exception handling when entry conditions are not satisfied.

requirement: In remote control mode, it is the same as during the taxi phase, where vk_may_brake = 80 km/h.
safety_requirements: In remote control mode, the system should check whether the speed during the taxiing phase has reached 80 km/h. If not, the warning mechanism shall be triggered.

The system should be equipped with a timeout judgment function in remote control mode; if the hardware status fails to meet the control requirements for an extended period, the alarm mechanism shall be triggered.

The system in remote control mode should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions; otherwise, the early warning mechanism will be triggered.

When the system is in remote control mode, it should check whether the functional inputs take into account the work phase and working status. If not considered, the alarm mechanism should be triggered.
When the system is in remote control mode, it should check whether the sensor acquisition range is clear. If the value exceeds the acquisition range, a sensor failure should be reported.

When the system is in remote control mode, it should check whether the control resolution results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values. If an abnormal value is detected, the early warning mechanism shall be triggered.

requirement: If the full gear compression signal is valid and the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake, then δb = 0.
safety_requirements: The system should check the validity of the landing gear full compression signal and the condition that airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake, ensuring the calculation result of δb = 0 is accurate and meets the current flight status and target status.
The system shall perform real-time consistency checks when calculating δb = 0 to ensure alignment with the flight status and target status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should perform boundary value checks on the calculation results of δb = 0 to ensure they are within the normal range, preventing abnormal or extreme values from occurring.

The system should have a false alarm prevention mechanism to ensure that fault detection does not generate false alarms, and the false alarm prevention process does not affect the real-time requirements of alarm handling.

The system should check the calculation results of δb = 0 according to different working phases and states, analyze the correctness of functional processing without considering the working phase or state, and make corresponding corrections.

The system should have a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring the accuracy and real-time performance of the calculation result δb = 0.

requirement: δb is limited within [-XfB, XfB]. XfB is the maximum proportional braking amount, which can be set via remote control, with a default value of 40%.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the maximum proportional braking amount XfB in the remote control settings is within the valid range, and ensure that δb is limited within [-XfB, XfB]. If the value exceeds this range, the alarm mechanism should be triggered.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the δb limit, and when δb exceeds the range [-XfB, XfB], the system should automatically truncate or output according to the safety value to prevent loss of control.

The system should verify the setting of the maximum proportional braking amount XfB to ensure it is within the valid range, and under different operating conditions and phases, the calculated results of δb limiting are accurate and meet safety requirements.

The system should have a timeout judgment mechanism. When the δb limit adjustment times out or the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, the system should trigger a warning mechanism and take appropriate measures to ensure system safety.

The system should check the control solution results for δb amplitude limiting, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values," and ensure that δb amplitude limiting remains within the range [-XfB, XfB].

requirement: The system should support autonomous throttle control for climb phase 1.
safety_requirements: When the system performs autonomous throttle control during climb phase 1, it shall ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, and to trigger the early warning mechanism.

The system should correctly handle the timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships among functional control logics to ensure the correctness and safety of the control logic.
The system should monitor and determine the compatibility between hardware status and control requirements, and take appropriate measures when incompatibility is detected.

The system should check the control calculation results, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control calculation results are "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", and ensure the accuracy and safety of the control results.

The system should ensure the real-time performance and reliability of the autonomous throttle control function, guaranteeing the correct execution of control commands and real-time monitoring of hardware status.

requirement: If δb < 0, then δbL = -δb + YzBL + YjB, δbR = YzBL + YjB; otherwise δbL = YzBL + YjB, δbR = δb + YzBR + YjB.
safety_requirements: The system should check the cycle of interface data to ensure that the calculation results of δbL and δbR are accurate and meet the expected behavior when the input value cycle is greater than the specified cycle, less than the specified cycle, or at extreme maximum or minimum values.

The system should check the data bit value accuracy of the interface data, analyze the correctness of the calculation results of δbL and δbR in cases where the data bit value accuracy is less than or greater than the required accuracy, and ensure that the error remains within the specified range.

The system should check the control solution results, analyze the correctness of the calculated δbL and δbR values under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, ensuring consistency with expected behavior.

The system should avoid division by zero during data processing, ensuring that the calculated values of δbL and δbR remain valid and correct under all possible input conditions, preventing system crashes or incorrect results.

The system should check the value of δb. When δb < 0, ensure the calculation formulas for δbL and δbR are δbL = -δb + YzBL + YjB and δbR = YzBL + YjB. When δb ≥ 0, ensure the calculation formulas for δbL and δbR are δbL = YzBL + YjB and δbR = δb + YzBR + YjB, to guarantee the accuracy and consistency of calculation results.

requirement: YzBL and YzBR are the left and right brake presets, which can be set via remote control. The default value is 10%.
safety_requirements: The system should perform validity checks on the set values of YzBL and YzBR to ensure they are within a reasonable range (0% to 100%), and trigger an error message when the set values exceed this range.
The system shall check the default values of YzBL and YzBR (10%) to ensure that the brake preset value is at the default setting when no remote control settings are applied.
The system shall monitor the setting processes of YzBL and YzBR in real time to prevent misoperations and ensure the correctness and consistency of the set values.
The system shall perform boundary checks on the calculated brake precharge volume to ensure the result is within the expected range, and trigger a warning mechanism if the result exceeds this range.
The system should have a shielding detection function to prevent unintended operations, avoiding errors in brake pre-set values caused by operational mistakes.
The system should check the sensor's acquisition range to ensure it is clearly defined and report a sensor fault if the acquired value exceeds the range.
The system should check its status after a power failure and restart, ensure correct status recovery, and trigger an alarm mechanism if the status recovery fails.

requirement: YjB is the emergency brake bias, which is 0 under normal conditions and 30% when the link is interrupted.
safety_requirements: The system shall perform real-time monitoring of the YjB value, and when a link interruption occurs, the YjB value shall automatically adjust to 30%, ensuring that this adjustment does not cause system instability or erroneous operation.
The system should perform boundary checks on changes in the YjB value to ensure it remains within the normal range (0 to 30%) and trigger a warning mechanism if it exceeds this range.
The system should be able to detect link interruption conditions and correctly calculate the YjB value in such cases, ensuring system safety and reliability.

The system should have a false alarm prevention mechanism to ensure that no false alarm signals are generated during link interruptions or other abnormal conditions, thereby affecting the normal operation of the system.

The system should be capable of real-time monitoring of interface data communication, and correctly handle YjB value calculation and adjustment in case of communication interruption, to ensure the safety and reliability of the system.

The system should be capable of performing real-time consistency checks on the calculated YjB values to ensure their alignment with the current system status and preset parameters, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: After performing the calculation according to a), the resulting max(δbL ,δbR ) ≤1.
safety_requirements: After the system completes the calculation, it should check whether the value of max(δbL, δbR) meets the condition ≤1, and trigger a warning mechanism if the condition is not satisfied.

The system should perform a categorized check on the resolution results to ensure correct handling under situations such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values," and take corresponding measures in case of anomalies.
The system should check for division by zero during data processing and take exception handling measures if division by zero exists.

The system should perform different control resolution processes according to various operating states and stages, and check whether the inputs have considered the operating stage and state, ensuring the correctness of functional processing.
The system should check the data bit value accuracy of the interface data to ensure it meets the accuracy requirements, and take corrective actions when the accuracy does not meet the requirements.

The system should have a clear handling strategy for output data exceeding limits, such as truncation or outputting according to safe values, and ensure that the output remains within the safety range.

requirement: The specific softening time should be determined based on control requirements, actual needs, and previous control experience.
safety_requirements: The system should determine the softening time based on control requirements, practical needs, and previous control experience, and ensure that this time is coordinated with the hardware to avoid control errors caused by timing mismatches.

When the system is performing control operations, it should check the completeness and consistency of control conditions, ensure that the control sequence and timing meet the expected requirements, and be able to properly handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to promptly identify and handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing the system from entering an unpredictable state.

The system should consider scenario requirements and hardware status when outputting control states, ensuring correct timing of the output to avoid control errors or hardware damage caused by improper timing.

After the system performs hardware control, it should monitor the hardware status in real time and determine whether it matches the control requirements. If not, it should trigger an early warning mechanism or corrective actions to ensure system safety and reliability.

The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships among the control logic of each functional point, avoiding system failures or safety hazards caused by logical errors.

requirement: The transition into and out of the ground waiting phase is made more reliable through a two-out-of-three switching command selection.
safety_requirements: During the transition into and out of the ground waiting phase, the system should improve reliability through a triple modular redundancy (TMR) approach using switching commands, ensuring the correctness and consistency of the transition operations.

When the system enters or exits the ground waiting phase, it should check the functions with different priorities set under two or more states that have transition relationships, and analyze the correctness of states and functions when switching from high priority to low priority and from low priority to high priority.

When the system is controlling the transition into and out of the ground waiting phase, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and avoid errors caused by discrepancies in hardware status.

When the system enters and exits the ground waiting phase, it should check the operating status of different redundancies, analyze the correctness of function implementation when two or more redundancies are in different states, and ensure the system's behavior consistency under various states.

The system should implement timeout detection when performing critical controls or actions, in order to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing the system from remaining in an uncontrollable state for a prolonged time.

requirement: The transition conditions for other phases should be judged multiple times according to specific circumstances, and phase transition shall only occur when the results of five consecutive judgments are consistent, in order to reduce the probability of misjudgment.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that transition conditions for other phases are only executed when the results of five consecutive evaluations are consistent, in order to reduce the probability of misjudgment, and record the evaluation results after each judgment for traceability and analysis.

The system should check the transition relationships between the same state and multiple other states, analyze the correctness of state transitions when multiple transition conditions are satisfied simultaneously, and ensure the logical consistency and accuracy of state transitions.

The system should set priorities for state transitions. When a high-priority state needs to switch to a low-priority state or a low-priority state needs to switch to a high-priority state, the system should perform special handling to ensure the correctness and consistency of the state transition, and record the reason and result of the transition.

The system should check states between two or more states that do not have transition relationships, analyze the correctness of state execution under conditions such as "simultaneously satisfied" and "satisfied during state execution", and ensure the logical correctness and consistency of state execution.

The system shall ensure that when two or more states with transfer relationships have different execution requirements for the same function, the execution status of the function remains consistent before and after the state transfer, avoiding confusion in function execution caused by state transfer, and record the function execution status before and after the state transfer.

The system shall perform real-time monitoring and checking of state entry conditions, analyze the correctness of state execution under situations such as "condition met, condition not met, condition met again" during state execution, ensure the correctness and consistency of state execution logic, and trigger a warning mechanism when conditions are not satisfied.

requirement: After the flight control computer is powered on the ground or the aircraft is fully landed and the flight control pre-shutdown command is issued, it enters the ground waiting phase.
safety_requirements: After the flight control computer is powered on the ground or the aircraft is fully landed, the system should correctly enter the ground waiting phase and be able to identify the current operating phase, avoiding functional anomalies caused by incorrect identification of the operating phase.

The system should be able to correctly execute the functional resolution process in different operational phases and states, and should be capable of detecting and correcting functional processing errors caused by failure to consider the current phase or state.

After a software power failure and restart, the system shall be able to automatically check and restore to the correct state, ensuring the correctness of state execution, and capable of handling situations where the state is not restored or incorrectly restored after restart.

For critical control or operation, the system should implement a reasonable timeout detection mechanism to promptly handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, thereby preventing system failures or safety risks that may result.

The system should be capable of effectively checking and verifying the control solution results to ensure they fall within normal ranges, and correctly handle special cases such as invalid values, boundary values, maximums, and minimums, preventing system errors or safety issues caused by abnormal results.

The system shall be capable of monitoring and handling timeout situations during the execution of control calculations, ensuring that the calculation process completes within the specified time frame and correctly addressing any timeouts that occur during the calculation process to prevent system failures or safety risks caused by such timeouts.

requirement: During the ground taxiing phase (including takeoff and landing taxiing), after receiving a ground hold command sent remotely, the system transitions to the ground hold phase.
safety_requirements: After receiving the ground waiting command from the remote control, the system should check its current operational phase and status to ensure the correctness of transitioning into the ground waiting phase, and perform corresponding functional control calculations based on different operational phases and statuses.

After the system recovers from power failure or the runaway reset mechanism is activated, it should be able to return to a normal operating state and continue to correctly perform the functions of the ground waiting phase.

The system should be equipped with a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where the hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, especially during the ground taxi phase, ensuring the system can respond promptly and take appropriate measures.

The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure correct functional execution during the ground waiting phase and seamless integration with functions in other phases.

The system should check the consistency between the task execution sequence and the specified sequence. When inconsistencies occur, the system should correctly handle the situation and take appropriate measures to ensure continued normal operation.

requirement: When max(δbL, δbR) > 100%, if δbL ≥ δbR, set δbR = δbR - (δbL - 100), δbL = 100%; if δbR > δbL, set δbL = δbL - (δbR - 100), δbR = 100%. This ensures that the left and right brakes meet the differential travel requirement.
safety_requirements: The system should check the calculated δbL and δbR values. When max(δbL, δbR) > 100%, adjust δbL and δbR according to the rules to ensure that the left and right brakes meet the differential requirement, and verify the correctness of the adjusted values.
