requirement: The amplitude can be adjusted by fine-tuning the throttle valve. Above 5000 meters, the adjustment range is [0%, 40%]; below 5000 meters, no adjustment is allowed.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that above 5,000 meters, the amplitude adjustment range via fine-tuning of the throttle valve is [0%, 40%], and perform real-time monitoring and verification within this range.
The system should prohibit amplitude changes below 5000 meters and display a prompt or alarm to prevent unauthorized operation.
The system should check the input value for the throttle fine adjustment to ensure it is within the specified range, and trigger an alarm or fault handling mechanism if the value exceeds the range.

The system should perform real-time checks on the control calculation results, analyzing and handling situations such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values" to ensure the correctness and safety of the functions.

The system should perform real-time checks on the data bit value accuracy of interface data, analyze situations where the data bit value accuracy is less than or greater than the required accuracy, and handle and alarm the output results accordingly.

The system should monitor the rate of parameter changes in real time to ensure they remain within reasonable limits, and take clear handling strategies when exceeding the limits to prevent system instability or failure.

requirement: Md2(k) = KhdI * Md1(k), with Md2(k) clamped within [-XfSita, XfSita]
safety_requirements: The system should perform a range check on the calculation result of Md2(k) to ensure it falls within the range [-XfSita, XfSita], and trigger an exception handling mechanism when the result exceeds this range.
The system should check the data bit value accuracy of Md1(k) and KhdI to ensure it meets the precision requirements; otherwise, it will affect the calculation accuracy of Md2(k).

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the calculation results for Md2(k), analyze whether they are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and trigger corresponding handling mechanisms based on the situation.

The system should distinguish the calculation process of Md2(k) under different states and working phases, ensuring that the calculation results of Md2(k) are accurate and meet the requirements in each phase and state.

The system shall perform consistency checks on the computation results of Md2(k) to ensure that the output data values are consistent under different redundancies, and the difference between the values does not exceed the specified threshold; otherwise, the exception handling mechanism shall be triggered.

requirement: Md3(k) = Khd · [h(k) - hg(k)] + Md2(k), with Md3(k) clamped within [-XfSita, XfSita]
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the calculation results of Md3(k) in real time to ensure they remain within the range [-XfSita, XfSita]. When the results exceed this range, the exception handling mechanism should be triggered.

The system shall verify the calculation process of Md3(k) to ensure the correctness of the formula Md3(k) = Khd. [h(k) - hg(k)], and shall re-verify the calculation results when parameters Khd, h(k), or hg(k) change.

The system should perform validity checks on the input parameters h(k) and hg(k) to ensure that when they are normal values, boundary values, or extreme values, the calculation result of Md3(k) is accurate and can properly handle abnormal values.

The system should perform precision checks on the calculated result Md3(k) to ensure it meets the required precision. If the precision is not met, appropriate measures should be taken to improve the precision or issue a warning.

The system should adjust the calculation process of Md3(k) according to different working states and stages, ensuring accurate calculation results of Md3(k) under each state and stage, and correctly handling transitions between states or stages.

The system should check the length of the interface data frame to ensure it complies with the specified length in the communication protocol, and take appropriate corrective actions or issue error messages when the length is incorrect.

requirement: When the flight altitude is not greater than 150m, phase transition processing is performed based on the current phase flag and status information such as current flight altitude and airspeed.
safety_requirements: When the system is flying at an altitude not exceeding 150 m, it should perform phase transition processing according to the current phase identifier and flight status information, and ensure the correctness of states and functions during the transition process, especially in cases of switching between high priority and low priority levels.

When the system transitions between operating states, the values of functional interface data should be checked to ensure correctness of outputs in cases where the "value changes" or "range of values changes", and to adapt to variations in status information such as flight altitude and airspeed.

The system should check the transition conditions between every two states in the software state space, analyze the correctness of state transitions under conditions such as "not set", "always satisfied", and "cannot be satisfied", to ensure the accuracy and reliability of phase transition processing.

The system should check the communication protocol of the interface data frame, analyze the correctness of the output when the data length is "greater than the specified length", "less than the specified length", etc., and ensure the correctness of phase transition processing based on the current phase flag and flight status information when the flight altitude is not greater than 150m.

The system shall ensure the correctness of functional control calculation processes under different states and operational phases, particularly considering the influence of operational phases and states, to guarantee the accuracy and reliability of phase transition handling.

requirement: Jg(k) = -Md3(k)
safety_requirements: The system should check the data bit value accuracy of the interface data to ensure it meets the required precision. When the data bit value accuracy is less than the required precision, the calculation result of Jg(k) = -Md3(k) shall be accurate and reliable.

The system should check the data bit value accuracy of the interface data to ensure it meets the required precision. When the data bit value accuracy exceeds the required precision, the calculation result of Jg(k) = -Md3(k) shall be accurate and reliable.

The system should check the cycle of interface data to ensure it meets the specified cycle requirements. When the input value cycle is greater than, less than, or at extreme maximum or minimum values relative to the specified cycle, the calculation result of Jg(k) = -Md3(k) must be accurate and reliable.

The system should check the control solution results to ensure that when they are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, the calculation result of Jg(k) = -Md3(k) is accurate and reliable, and can properly handle these situations.

The system should check the data processing process to ensure that there is no division by zero, prevent calculation errors or system crashes caused by division by zero, and ensure that the calculation result of Jg(k) = -Md3(k) is accurate and reliable.

requirement: When |DH| > 50m, the flight phase transitions from the constant altitude segment to the climb 2 or descent segment.
safety_requirements: When |DH| > 50m, the flight phase transitions from the constant altitude segment to the climbing phase 2 or descending segment. The system shall check the rate of change of the altitude difference |DH| to ensure it is within a reasonable range and handle data that exceeds this range.

The system shall monitor the height difference |DH| collected by the sensors and check whether it is within the specified measurement range. When the range is exceeded, the system shall report a sensor failure.

During the flight phase transition, the system should check the values of functional interface data, analyze the correctness of outputs in cases such as "value changes" or "value range changes", and ensure the correctness of the state and functions after transition.

The system should check the switching logic of functions with different priorities during flight phase transitions, and analyze the correctness of states and functions in scenarios such as "high priority switching to low priority" and "low priority switching to high priority".

The system should check the communication protocol of the interface data frame, analyze the correctness of the output when the data length is "greater than the specified length" or "less than the specified length", and ensure the reliability of data transmission.

The system should monitor changes in the height difference |DH| in real time, and when |DH| > 50m, the system should automatically trigger a flight phase transition and ensure the correctness of the state and functions after the transition.

requirement: Md2(k) = Kp1I · Md1(k), Md2(k) limited to [Xf, Xfx]
safety_requirements: The system should check the value range of the Md2(k) calculation result to ensure it is within the [Xf, Xfx] range. If it exceeds the range, the exception handling mechanism should be triggered.
The system should check the value accuracy of the data bits for Md1(k) and Kp1 to ensure they meet the precision requirements; if not, error handling should be performed.

The system should monitor the calculation results of Md2(k) in real time, analyze whether they are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and handle them accordingly.
The system should adjust the calculation process of Md2(k) according to different operating states and phases, ensuring the correctness of its calculation results under various states and phases.
The system should monitor the communication status of interface data frames. If data frame loss occurs, error handling shall be performed to ensure the correctness of the Md2(k) calculation result.

requirement: Flight situation on the five-side route, longitudinal: The underscored sections are both limited to [-XfSita, XfSita]
safety_requirements: While flying on the final approach leg, the system shall monitor the longitudinal amplitude limit in real time to ensure it remains within the range of [-XfSita, XfSita], and trigger an alarm mechanism if this range is exceeded.

The system should be able to detect the operating status of different redundancies and automatically switch to safety mode when two or more redundancies are in different states, ensuring the correctness of functions.

The sensor acquisition range should have clearly defined upper and lower limits. When the sensor reading exceeds the acquisition range, the system should automatically report a sensor fault and trigger the backup mechanism.

The system should compare the continuous output data values of different redundancies in real time, and when the values are inconsistent (i.e., the difference between the values exceeds the specified threshold), the system should automatically adjust the output or trigger an alarm mechanism.

The system should be able to detect the same input data values received through different redundancy channels, and when the values are inconsistent, the system should automatically initiate a data verification procedure to ensure functional correctness.

requirement: The system should be capable of calculating and providing the velocity solution relationship for a 200m altitude flight on the five-side approach path.
safety_requirements: When calculating the velocity solution relationship for the 200m flight altitude on the downwind leg, the system should be able to distinguish between 'normal values', 'abnormal values', 'boundary values' and 'maximum/minimum values', and ensure the accuracy and consistency of the solution results.

The system should monitor in real-time the velocity resolution process during the 200m altitude flight along the final approach path. If the resolution process times out or fails to return results within the specified time, an alarm mechanism should be triggered and corresponding measures taken.

The system shall perform real-time consistency checks on the velocity resolution results at a flight altitude of 200m during the downwind leg, ensuring that the parameter variation rate remains within reasonable limits (upper and lower slope bounds). For data exceeding these slope limits, a clear handling strategy shall be in place.

The system should adaptively adjust the velocity resolution process for the 200m flight altitude during different flight phases and conditions to ensure accuracy and consistency of the resolution results under all operational phases and states.

The system should be able to identify and handle abnormal external factors (such as high sea conditions, severe weather conditions, etc.), and adjust and verify the speed solution results at 200m flight altitude during the final approach to ensure flight safety.

requirement: The system should be capable of achieving lateral control, the same as in the climb phase 2.
safety_requirements: When the system performs lateral control, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, the control conditions are complete and consistent, avoiding control conflicts or omissions.

The system should correctly implement the temporal relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships among functional point control logics to ensure the correctness and consistency of the control process.

For critical controls or actions, the system should implement a timeout detection mechanism to handle situations where hardware states fail to meet control requirements for an extended period, preventing system hang-ups or entering indeterminate states.

The system should monitor and evaluate the hardware status in real time after performing hardware control, ensuring the correctness and reliability of the control effect by verifying the consistency between the actual hardware status and the control requirements.

The system should output control status at appropriate times that meet scenario requirements, ensuring the timeliness and effectiveness of control information, and avoiding control failure or misoperation caused by improper timing of outputs.

requirement: The system should be capable of achieving throttle airspeed closed-loop control, where the given airspeed ug is calculated based on the aircraft's flight performance, with data referring to the approach speed in Appendix.
safety_requirements: When the system performs throttle airspeed closed-loop control, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, control conditions are complete and consistent, to avoid safety risks caused by control logic errors.

The system should perform real-time checks on the control calculation results, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values," and ensure the accuracy and reliability of the control results.

The system should adjust the control solution process according to specific conditions under different states and operational phases, taking into account the influence of operational phases and states to ensure the correctness and safety of function processing.
The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships among the control logic of each functional point, to avoid safety hazards caused by logic errors.

When the system executes multiple functions in sequence, it should check the output data of the preceding function, and analyze the correctness of multi-function processing under conditions such as 'boundary value combinations, initial value combinations, safety value combinations, default value combinations', to ensure data consistency and safety.

The system should be capable of detecting and handling abnormal control solution results, such as values exceeding preset ranges or unexpected values, promptly triggering warning mechanisms or taking corrective actions to ensure safe system operation.

requirement: The system should be capable of performing discretized calculations, including the computation of Md2(k), Md3(k), and Jg(k), and should also apply amplitude limiting to Md2(k) and Md3(k).
safety_requirements: The system should limit the calculation results of Md2(k) and Md3(k) to ensure they are within predefined ranges, and trigger an exception handling mechanism when exceeding these ranges.

The system should monitor in real-time the calculation results of Md2(k), Md3(k), and Jg(k), analyze whether they are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and take appropriate measures according to the situation.
The system should check the output data value consistency of Md2(k) and Md3(k). When inconsistency is detected, an alert mechanism should be triggered for further error analysis and handling.

The system should adjust and optimize the calculation processes of Md2(k), Md3(k), and Jg(k) according to different operational statuses and phases, ensuring the correctness and reliability of functions under various statuses and phases.

The system should perform validity checks on data bits with discrete value ranges in the interface data to ensure their values fall within predefined valid ranges, and handle any abnormal values outside these valid ranges.

The system should perform output checks on the calculation results of Md2(k), Md3(k), and Jg(k), analyze whether they meet the expected output, and trigger a warning mechanism when the output results are abnormal.

requirement: The system should be capable of achieving longitudinal control during the descent phase, similar to climb phase 1, where the given airspeed ug is calculated based on aircraft flight performance and boundary points are limited.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the functional inputs consider the operational phases and states during the longitudinal control in the descent phase, to ensure the correctness of functional control calculation processes under different states and operational phases.

The system shall ensure that the sequence and timing of control are coordinated with the hardware, with complete and consistent control conditions to prevent control errors caused by hardware malcoordination.

The system should check the control calculation results, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control calculation results are normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, and ensure the calculation results fall within the expected range.
The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships between functional control logics to avoid control errors caused by logic mistakes.
The system should output the control status at the appropriate time that meets the scenario requirements, ensuring correct timing of the output and avoiding improper control caused by timing errors.

The system should verify the calculation process of the given airspeed ug, ensure that it is derived from the aircraft's flight performance calculations, and apply limiters to boundary points to prevent control errors caused by incorrect airspeed calculations.

requirement: The system should be capable of achieving lateral control during the descent phase, same as in climb phase 2.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing during the lateral-directional control in the descent phase are coordinated consistently with the hardware, with complete and coherent control conditions, to avoid safety risks caused by control logic errors.

The system should correctly distinguish different working phases and states, and during the lateral control in the descending phase, perform corresponding control calculations according to the actual working state and phase, preventing control errors caused by neglecting the working phase or state.

The control logic among various functional points in the system should have correct timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrency relationships, and combination relationships, to ensure coordinated operation of each functional point during the lateral-directional control process in the descent phase, avoiding safety issues caused by logical relationship errors.

The system should perform real-time checks on the lateral control solution results during the descent phase, analyze the functional processing correctness of the control solution results under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values, to ensure the reliability and safety of the control results.

In the lateral control of the system during the descent phase, it should correctly handle the operating status of different redundancies, especially when two or more redundancies are in different states. The system should properly implement its functions to avoid safety risks caused by inconsistent statuses.

requirement: During the transition process of non-remote control mode, a series of phase transitions may occur until switching to a flight phase suitable for the current state.
safety_requirements: During the transition process of non-remote control mode, the system should be able to correctly identify the flight phase corresponding to the current state and ensure the correctness and safety of the phase transition.

The system shall check functional inputs and analyze the correctness of functional processing under different states and operational phases, ensuring the correctness of functional processing regardless of the operational phase or state considered.

The system should be equipped with a timeout determination mechanism for critical controls or actions to handle situations where hardware status fails to meet control requirements for an extended period, ensuring the safety and stability of the system.

When the system transitions between operational states, it should check the values of functional interface data, analyze the correctness of outputs when values or value ranges change, and ensure the safety and correctness of state transitions.

The system should check the control solution results of the functions, analyze the correctness of functional processing under conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, to ensure the safety and stability of the system.

The system should check and analyze the correctness of states and functions in cases where high-priority switches to low-priority or low-priority switches to high-priority, for two or more states with transition relationships and different priorities, to ensure system safety and stability.

The system shall ensure that during the transition processing in non-remote control mode, the sequence and timing of phase transitions are correct, avoiding system failures or safety issues caused by phase transition errors.

requirement: The system should be capable of achieving throttle valve control, retracting the throttle valve according to the minimum throttle valve limit value, which can be adjusted through throttle valve fine-tuning. The default values of this minimum throttle valve limit shall be provided at altitudes of 5000, 6000, 7000, and 8000 meters, with linear interpolation applied for intermediate altitudes. Above 5000 meters, the adjustment range during descent is [-10%.
safety_requirements: When the system performs fixed throttle control, it should check whether the minimum throttle limit value is set correctly, ensuring that default values are provided at altitudes of 5000, 6000, 7000, and 8000 meters, with accurate limit values obtained through linear interpolation between these points.
The system should monitor the fine adjustment of the throttle valve in real time to ensure that the change does not exceed -10% during descent, and trigger a warning mechanism when out of range.

The system should coordinate with the hardware in terms of control sequence and timing to ensure complete and consistent control conditions, avoiding equipment failure or safety hazards caused by improper control.

The system should check the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, and ensure that the system can correctly handle control requirements in various situations.

The system should clearly define the sensor's measurement range (upper and lower limits) and report a sensor fault when the measured value exceeds the range, ensuring the system can correctly monitor and control the equipment status.

The system should have different control solution processes under various states and operational phases. The functional inputs must be checked, and the correctness of functional processing should be analyzed in scenarios where operational phases or states are not considered, ensuring the system can correctly adapt to different operating conditions.

The system's fault detection logic should be reasonable, and the detection method should not affect the normal operation of the equipment, ensuring the system can correctly detect and handle fault conditions, avoiding equipment damage or safety hazards caused by improper detection.

requirement: Flight Phase Determination Functional Requirement: Automatically determine the current flight phase based on the aircraft's position information and motion parameter information.
safety_requirements: The system should be able to automatically determine the current flight phase based on the aircraft's position information and motion parameter information, and correctly control the solution process under different states and operational phases, ensuring the correctness and consistency of functional inputs.

The system should be able to detect cases where the input data values cause the task execution conditions to be met prematurely, and ensure the correctness and real-time performance of the functional processing in such cases.

The system shall be able to check the software status corresponding to the system status, operation phase, or system task, and ensure the correctness and safety of status execution when the corresponding software status does not exist or is inconsistent with the system.

The system should be able to detect cases where the input data values cause delays in meeting the task execution conditions, and ensure the correctness and real-time performance of the functional processing in such cases.

The system should be able to check the status of external devices (such as sensors, NVM, databases, other systems, etc.), and ensure the correctness and reliability of outputs when the source device is in a degraded or maintenance state.

The system should be capable of monitoring changes in flight phases in real time and updating the flight phase determination function accordingly to ensure the system's real-time performance and safety.

requirement: Ground waiting phase: The aircraft is in a shutdown state before takeoff and after complete landing.
safety_requirements: During the ground waiting phase, the system should check whether the aircraft is in a parked state and ensure the correctness of state transitions before takeoff and after complete landing.

The system should monitor the entry conditions of the ground waiting phase to ensure the correctness of state execution when the entry conditions are met, not met, or met again during the state execution process.
The system should check the transition relationships between the ground waiting phase and other states to ensure that no illegal state transitions occur during state execution.
The system should be able to detect software power failure restart events and check the correctness of state recovery after restart, preventing incomplete or incorrect state recovery.

The system should check the operational status of external devices (such as sensors, NVM, databases, other systems, etc.) to ensure the correctness of outputs when the devices are in a power-off or initialization state.

The system should correctly control the resolution process of functions according to different working phases and states, ensuring the correct handling of function inputs under various states and working phases.

requirement: Takeoff ground phase (takeoff roll phase): Control the aircraft's lateral deviation and yaw angle relative to the runway centerline through differential braking on left and right landing gears and rudder deflection; control the aircraft's longitudinal motion according to a given pitch angle.
safety_requirements: During the takeoff ground phase, the system should be able to correctly calculate and control the left and right differential brakes and rudder deflection based on the current state and operational phase, ensuring accurate control of the aircraft's lateral deviation from the runway centerline and yaw angle, and properly switching control strategies when the state or phase changes.

During the takeoff ground phase, the system should be capable of real-time monitoring the longitudinal status of the aircraft and correctly control the aircraft's longitudinal movement based on the given pitch angle to ensure safe takeoff.

The system should be able to check and analyze the correctness of inputs during the control solution process, ensuring the correctness of functional processing under different states and operational phases, and capable of handling abnormal inputs and boundary value situations.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of control during aircraft takeoff are coordinated with the hardware, that control conditions are complete and consistent, and that safety risks caused by improper control are avoided.

During the takeoff ground phase, the system should be capable of monitoring and analyzing the operational status of different redundancies, and correctly perform its function when two or more redundancies are in different states, ensuring safety during aircraft takeoff.

requirement: Takeoff climb segment: From the point where altitude and airspeed reach certain values to the safety altitude, primarily controlling the aircraft to climb at a specific pitch angle.
safety_requirements: During the takeoff departure phase, the system should check whether the aircraft's altitude and airspeed have reached certain values to ensure accurate judgment of safe altitude, and then control the aircraft to climb at a specific pitch angle.

The system should monitor the aircraft's operational phase and status in real time to ensure the correctness of the control solution process. When the operational phase or status changes, the system should be able to automatically adjust the control strategy.

The system shall perform real-time checks on the control solution results to ensure they remain within normal ranges. When abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values occur, the system shall automatically trigger warning mechanisms or corrective actions.

The system shall monitor the entry conditions in real time to ensure their satisfaction during state execution, and when the entry conditions are not met, the system shall be able to automatically adjust the state execution strategy or trigger a warning mechanism.

The system shall perform real-time monitoring of the control calculation process to ensure that the control calculation is completed within the specified time. When a timeout occurs, the system shall automatically trigger an alarm mechanism or corrective actions.

The system should monitor in real-time the operational status of different redundancies, ensuring the correctness of functional implementation when two or more redundancies are in different states. When a state conflict occurs, the system should be able to automatically adjust the state or trigger a warning mechanism.

requirement: Climb Segment 1: From the safety altitude (80m) to the phase where flaps are retracted. The main task is to control the aircraft to continue climbing, transitioning longitudinal control to airspeed control, and retracting the landing gear and flaps in sequence.
safety_requirements: During the system's climb phase 1, the current operating phase and status should be checked to ensure the correctness of functional inputs, preventing erroneous processing due to overlooking the operating phase or status.

The system shall perform real-time checks on the conditions for entering a state, analyze the fulfillment of these conditions during state execution, ensure the correctness of state execution, and trigger a warning mechanism when conditions are not met.

The system shall perform real-time checks on the control solution results, analyze the validity of the control solution results, ensure the correctness of functional processing, and take appropriate measures when abnormal or boundary values occur.

The system should check the functions under states with transition relationships, analyze the switching between high-priority and low-priority functions, ensure the correctness of states and functions, and follow established rules in case of priority conflicts.

When the system transitions between operational states, the values of functional interface data should be checked to ensure that changes in values or ranges do not lead to incorrect outputs, and output results should be updated when necessary.

requirement: Climb Segment 2: From flap retraction until reaching the required cruise altitude, or climbing from one altitude to a higher altitude, controlling the aircraft longitudinally according to the given airspeed and laterally to follow the pre-programmed flight path.
safety_requirements: During the system's climb phase 2, the current operating phase and status should be checked to ensure the correctness of longitudinal airspeed control and lateral control, and adjustments should be made according to the aircraft's altitude and route.

The system should monitor airspeed and lateral control in real time under different altitudes and routes, analyze the matching relationship between them, and trigger a warning mechanism when a mismatch occurs.

During the system's climb phase 2, the output data of the preceding function should be checked to ensure it is a normal or abnormal value, and corresponding functional processing and adjustments should be made based on different data values.

The system should check the functional processing during different operational phases and states, analyze the correctness of functions in cases such as "operational phase not considered" or "operational state not considered," and make corresponding adjustments and optimizations.

During the system's climb phase 2, multiple functions' serial execution should be checked, the output data of previous functions should be analyzed to ensure they are correct inputs for subsequent functions, and the correctness and consistency of multi-function processing must be guaranteed.

requirement: Altitude Hold Phase: Longitudinally control the aircraft's altitude and airspeed, and laterally control the lateral deviation to enable the aircraft to fly at the required altitude and airspeed.
safety_requirements: During the altitude hold phase, the system should correctly calculate and control the aircraft's altitude and airspeed based on the current operational phase and status, ensuring the aircraft flies at the required altitude and airspeed, and perform real-time checks and adjustments during status transitions.

The system shall check the inputs of longitudinal control and lateral-directional control, analyze the correctness of functional processing under different operational phases and conditions, and ensure the stability and safety of the aircraft.

When the system performs control calculations, it should check the reasonableness of the results to ensure that the calculation outcomes fall within normal ranges and can properly handle special cases such as boundary values, maximums, and minimums, preventing the aircraft from entering abnormal conditions.

The control sequence and timing of the system should be coordinated with the hardware equipment to ensure completeness and consistency of control conditions, avoiding safety hazards caused by timing issues.

The system should be equipped with a reasonable timeout mechanism to promptly detect and handle timeout situations during the control solution process, preventing the aircraft from entering an indeterminate state and ensuring flight safety.

The system should be capable of correctly implementing functions under different operating conditions, especially when two or more states change simultaneously, ensuring that the aircraft's control and navigation systems respond and adjust correctly to maintain flight stability and safety.

requirement: During descent below 5000 meters, the throttle limit is no less than 6%, and the change range is [-6.5%, 10%].
safety_requirements: When the system is descending, check the throttle limit settings to ensure that it is not less than 6%, and the change amount is within the range of [-6.5%, 10%]. An alarm mechanism will be triggered if the range is exceeded.

The system should check the sensor's acquisition range to ensure it is clear and within the valid range. If the range is exceeded, the system should report a sensor fault and take appropriate measures.

The system should monitor the parameter change rate to ensure it remains within reasonable limits (upper and lower slope bounds), and implement clear handling strategies, such as clamping or outputting safe values, when the range is exceeded.

The system should check the valid value range of parameters to ensure they are clearly defined and within the valid range. When values exceed the range, a clear handling strategy should be adopted, such as truncation or outputting a safe value.
The system should have a clear handling strategy when output data exceed limits, such as truncation or outputting according to safe values, to ensure system safety and stability.

The system should check the control solution results, analyze the correctness of functional processing in cases where the control solution results are "normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values", etc., to ensure the safety and stability of the system.

requirement: When the aircraft passes through an altitude of 5000 meters, linearly reduce the throttle trim adjustment to zero at a rate of 5% per second.
safety_requirements: When the aircraft passes through an altitude of 5000 meters, the system should monitor changes in the throttle trim adjustment, ensuring it linearly decreases to zero at a rate of 5% per second, without any occurrence other than zero.

The system should check whether the sensor's measurement range is clearly defined (upper and lower limits) and ensure that sensor faults are correctly reported when values exceed the measurement range.

After the system's power failure recovery or runaway reset mechanism is activated, it should be able to return to normal operating conditions and ensure accurate calculation and control of the throttle valve fine adjustment.
The system should have a clear handling strategy for output data exceeding limits, such as truncation or outputting according to safe values, to ensure output data remains within the safe range.
The system should evaluate the impact of filtering processing on real-time performance, ensuring that the impact remains within acceptable limits and can meet the safety requirements of the aircraft.
The system should be capable of real-time monitoring and recording changes in the throttle valve trim to ensure rapid response and correction in abnormal situations.

requirement: When the aircraft has already entered the descent phase, process the phase transition based on the current flight status.
safety_requirements: When the aircraft enters the glide phase, the system should check the current flight status to ensure the correctness of phase transition processing and prevent flight safety risks caused by state transition errors.

The system should analyze the value changes of functional interface data when the aircraft enters the glide phase, ensuring the correctness of phase transition processing, especially in cases such as "value change" or "change in value range".

When the aircraft enters the glide phase, the system should check the switching status of high-priority and low-priority functions to ensure correct execution of high-priority functions and prevent safety risks caused by priority errors.

The system should check the satisfaction of status entry conditions when the aircraft enters the glide phase, ensuring the correctness of phase transition processing, especially in cases such as "satisfied," "not satisfied," or "satisfied again."

When the aircraft enters the glide phase, the system should verify the correctness of functional inputs to ensure the accuracy of the control solution process, especially during different operational phases and states, to prevent safety risks caused by functional processing errors.

requirement: The longitudinal control for segment 1 glide slope is the same as that for the fixed height on the final approach, and the specified height is given in the glide path processing section of Volume VI.
safety_requirements: The height setting for longitudinal control during the first segment of descent should be within the specified reasonable range. Data exceeding this range should have a clear handling strategy to ensure system stability and safety.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of parameters related to longitudinal control during the glide phase, ensuring they remain within valid value ranges. Exceedance data should trigger a warning mechanism and have clear handling strategies.

The sequence and timing of longitudinal control during the first segment of descent should be coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and consistent to ensure system reliability and safety.

The system should ensure the correct timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships among the functional points of longitudinal control in the glide slope segment to avoid logic conflicts and errors.
